Aspartate aminotransferase (AST/SGOT), alanine aminotransferase (ALT/SGPT) and\n                  alkaline phosphatase ?.x upper limit of normal (ULN)\n\n                    -  If liver metastases are present, then ?x ULN is allowed.\n\n                    -  Patients receiving immunotherapy should have AST and ALT levels <.x ULN.\n\n          . Have acceptable renal function:\n\n             a. Calculated creatinine clearance ? mL/min\n\n         . Have acceptable hematologic status:\n\n               . Granulocyte ? cells/mm\n\n               . Platelet count ?, (plt/mm)\n\n               . Hemoglobin ? g/dL\n\n         . Have no clinically significant abnormalities on urinalysis\n\n         . Have acceptable coagulation status:\n\n               . Prothrombin time (PT) within .x normal limits\n\n               . Activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT) within .x normal limits\n\n         . Be nonfertile or agree to use an adequate method of contraception. Sexually active\n             patients and their partners must use an effective method of contraception (hormonal or\n             barrier method of birth control; or abstinence) prior to study entry and for the\n             duration of study participation and for at least  days after the last study drug\n             dose (see Section ..). Should a woman become pregnant or suspect she is pregnant\n             while participating in this study, she should inform her treating physician\n             immediately.\n\n         . Have read and signed the IRB-approved informed consent form prior to any study related\n             procedure. (In the event that the patient is re-screened for study participation or a\n             protocol amendment alters the care of an ongoing patient, a new informed consent form\n             must be signed.)\n\n         . Patients enrolled in each of the five Expansion Cohorts must be willing to consider\n             pre-study and on-study biopsies, if safe and medically feasible, as determined by\n             local interventional radiology ( to  core samples requested at each biopsy\n             timepoint)\n\n        Patients meeting any one of these exclusion criteria will be prohibited from participating\n        in this study:\n\n          . Have New York Heart Association (NYHA) Class III or IV, cardiac disease, myocardial\n             infarction within the past  months prior to Day , unstable arrhythmia, or evidence\n             of ischemia on electrocardiogram (ECG) or during Cardiac Stress Testing within  days\n             prior to Day  (Appendix C)\n\n          . Have a corrected QT interval (QTcF, Fridericia's method) of > msec in men and \n             msec in women\n\n          . Have a seizure disorders requiring anticonvulsant therapy\n\n          . Presence of symptomatic central nervous system metastatic disease or disease that\n             requires local therapy such as radiotherapy, surgery, or increasing dose of steroids\n             within the prior  weeks\n\n          . Have severe chronic obstructive pulmonary disease with hypoxemia (defined as resting\n             O saturation of ?% breathing room air)\n\n          . Have undergone major surgery, other than diagnostic surgery, within  weeks prior to\n             Day \n\n          . Have active, uncontrolled bacterial, viral, or fungal infections, requiring systemic\n             therapy\n\n          . Are pregnant or nursing\n\n          . Received treatment with radiation therapy, surgery, chemotherapy, or investigational\n             therapy within  days or  half lives, whichever occurs first, prior to study entry\n             ( weeks for nitrosoureas or Mitomycin C)\n\n             a. This exclusion criterion is not applicable for patients with EGFR+ NSCLC or\n             immunotherapy-resistant tumors who are enrolled in expansion cohorts at the MTD.\n\n         . Are unwilling or unable to comply with procedures required in this protocol\n\n         . Have known infection with human immunodeficiency virus (HIV), hepatitis B, or\n             hepatitis C. Patients with history of chronic hepatitis that is currently not active\n             are eligible\n\n         . Have a serious nonmalignant disease (eg, hydronephrosis, liver failure, or other\n             conditions) that could compromise protocol objectives in the opinion of the\n             investigator and/or the sponsor\n\n         . Are currently receiving any other investigational agent\n\n         . Have exhibited allergic reactions to a similar structural compound, biological agent,\n             or formulation\n\n         . Have undergone significant surgery to the gastrointestinal tract that could impair\n             absorption or that could result in short bowel syndrome with diarrhea due to\n             malabsorption\n\n         . Have a history of severe adverse reaction (eg, hypersensitivity reaction, anaphylaxis)\n             to sulfonamides
Inclusion criteria. Patients may be entered in the study only if they meet all of the\n        following criteria:\n\n        . Adults at least  years of age. . Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG)\n        performance status ?. .\n\n          . Subjects with histopathologically or cytologically confirmed diagnosis of cutaneous\n             Melanoma, RCC or NSCLC, for whom the use of nivolumab is indicated. NSCLC subjects\n             with EGFR or ALK genomic aberrations in tumor should have disease progression on\n             FDA-approved therapy for these aberrations prior to receiving nivolumab (Phase b).\n\n          . Subjects with histopathologically or cytologically confirmed diagnosis of cutaneous\n             Melanoma, or NSCLC, for whom the use of nivolumab is indicated. NCSLC subjects with\n             EGFR or ALK genomic aberrations in tumor should have disease progression on\n             FDA-approved therapy for these aberrations prior to receiving nivolumab (Phase \n             expansion).\n\n          . Cutaneous melanoma and NSCLC patients whose disease has progressed after achieving PR\n             or CR on previous treatment with antagonists to PD-PD-L axis, or patients whose\n             disease remains stable on previous treatment with antagonists to PD-PD-L axis and\n             modification to treatment is being considered. NSCLC patients with EGFR or ALK genomic\n             aberrations in tumor should have disease progression on FDA-approved therapy for these\n             aberrations prior to receiving nivolumab (Phase  expansion).\n\n             . Subject must have at least one measurable target lesion as defined by Response\n             Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) v...\n\n             . All prior systemic therapy (chemotherapy, mutation targeting therapy, immune\n             checkpoint therapy), surgical or radiation treatment must have been completed at least\n              weeks before study drug administration ( weeks for palliative radiotherapy,  week\n             for minor surgery) pending full recovery from therapy.\n\n             . The following laboratory results within  days prior to study drug administration:\n             Adequate hematopoietic, electrolyte, hepatic, and renal laboratory findings as defined\n             below: WBC ?/?L, Neutrophils ?/?L, Platelets ?x/?L, Hemoglobin ?.g/dL\n             independent of transfusion, Creatinine ?.mg/dL, AST and ALT ?x ULN, Alkaline\n             phosphatase ?.x ULN unless bone metastases present, Bilirubin ?.x ULN (unless\n             known Gilbert's disease where it must be ?x ULN) and serum albumin ?.g/dL.\n\n             . Life expectancy ? weeks. . A negative serum pregnancy test at baseline for women\n             of childbearing potential.\n\n             . Are willing to abstain from heterosexual activity or practice physical barrier\n             contraception prior to time of study entry to at least  months after the last day of\n             treatment.\n\n             . Have the ability to understand and the willingness to sign a written informed\n             consent document.\n\n             Exclusion criteria. Subjects who fulfill any of the following criteria at screening\n             will not be eligible for admission into the study:\n\n               . History of Grade  or above hypersensitivity reactions to other monoclonal\n                  antibodies.\n\n               . Subjects with a history of a cardiovascular illness including: QTcF >ms in\n                  male, and >ms in female, congenital long QT syndrome, congestive heart failure\n                  (New York Heart Association Grade III or IV); unstable angina or myocardial\n                  infarction within the previous  months; or symptomatic cardiac arrhythmia\n                  despite medical management.\n\n               . Uncontrolled hypertension, SBP > or DBP >.\n\n               . Subjects with untreated, or treated brain metastasis, unless stable for  weeks\n                  or more and not requiring steroids.\n\n               . Presence of leptomeningeal disease.\n\n               . History of hemorrhagic diarrhea, inflammatory bowel disease, active uncontrolled\n                  peptic ulcer disease or recurrent pleural effusion requiring repetitive\n                  palliative thoracentesis within  months prior to study entry, except for\n                  subjects with a pleurex port. and immune-mediated toxicity leading to treatment\n                  discontinuation\n\n               . Active, known, or suspected autoimmune disease, except for type I diabetes\n                  mellitus, hypothyroidism only requiring hormone replacement, skin disorders (such\n                  as vitiligo, psoriasis, or alopecia).\n\n               . Active uncontrolled bacterial, viral, or fungal infection requiring systemic\n                  therapy.\n\n               . Known history of testing positive for human immunodeficiency virus (HIV), known\n                  acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS).\n\n              . Active hepatitis B (serum hepatitis B surface antigen [HBV sAg] positive), or\n                  hepatitis C (HCV antibody test or serum hepatitis C RNA positive) indicating\n                  acute or chronic infection.\n\n              . Subjects with a condition requiring systemic treatment with either\n                  corticosteroids (>mg daily prednisone equivalents) or other immunosuppressive\n                  medications within  days of study drug administration. Inhaled or topical\n                  steroids are permitted.\n\n              . Use of other investigational agent (drug not marketed for any indication) within\n                   days or at least  half-lives (whichever is longer) before study drug\n                  administration.\n\n              . Pregnant or breast-feeding women.\n\n              . Second malignancy unless in remission for  years, except for non-melanomatous\n                  skin cancer, carcinoma in situ of the cervix treated with curative intent.\n\n              . Underlying medical conditions that, in the Investigator's opinion, will make the\n                  administration of study drug hazardous or obscure the interpretation of toxicity\n                  determination or adverse events.\n\n              . Unwilling or unable to comply with procedures required in this protocol.
Inclusion Criteria:\n\n        Subjects must meet all of the following criteria:\n\n          . Written and signed informed consent.\n\n          . Age ?  years at the time of study entry.\n\n          . Subjects must have received and have progressed, are refractory, or are intolerant to\n             standard therapy appropriate for the specific tumor type. Subjects should not have\n             received more than  prior lines of systemic therapy for recurrent or metastatic.\n\n          . Subjects in the dose-escalation phase, must have histologic documentation of advanced\n             solid tumors, excluding primary CNS tumors and hematologic malignancies.\n\n          . Subjects in the dose-expansion phase, must have recurrent or metastatic disease solid\n             tumors according to treatment arm as specified in the protocol.\n\n          . Subjects who have received prior therapy with regimens containing CTLA , PD L, or PD\n              antagonists are permitted to enroll if additional protocol criteria are met.\n\n          . Subjects must have at least  lesion that is measurable using RECIST guidelines.\n\n          . Subjects must consent to provide archived tumor specimens for correlative biomarker\n             studies. In the setting where archival material is unavailable or unsuitable for use,\n             subjects must consent and undergo fresh tumor biopsy.\n\n          . All subjects are encouraged to consent to and provide both pretreatment and on\n             treatment tumor biopsies.\n\n         . ECOG Performance score of  or , unless protocol exceptions are met.\n\n         . In the opinion of the investigator likely to complete ?  weeks of treatment.\n\n         . Adequate hematologic, renal and hepatic function as determined by blood laboratory\n             values.\n\n         . At the time of Day  of the study, subjects with CNS metastases must have been treated\n             and must be asymptomatic and meet the following:\n\n               . No concurrent treatment, inclusive of, but not limited to surgery, radiation,\n                  and/or corticosteroids\n\n               . At least  days without progression of CNS metastases as evidenced by magnetic\n                  resonance imaging (MRI) or computed tomography (CT) after last day of treatment\n\n               . At least  days since last dose of corticosteroids Note: Subjects with\n                  leptomeningeal disease or cord compression are excluded from the study.\n\n         . Female subjects of childbearing potential who are sexually active with a\n             non-sterilized male partner must use at least  highly effective method of\n             contraception from screening, and must agree to continue using such precautions for\n              days after the final dose of investigational product.\n\n         . Non-sterilized male subjects who are sexually active with a female partner of\n             childbearing potential must use male condom plus, if locally available, spermicide\n             from Day  and for  days after receipt of the final dose of investigational\n             product.\n\n        Exclusion Criteria:\n\n        Any of the following would exclude the subject from participation in the study:\n\n          . Prior treatment with TNFRSF agonists\n\n          . Prior treatment with IMT for certain disease types may be restricted per protocol.\n\n          . History of severe allergic reactions to any unknown allergens or any components of the\n             study drug formulations\n\n          . Active or prior documented autoimmune disease within the past  years.\n\n          . Concurrent enrollment in another clinical study, unless it is an observational\n             clinical study or the follow up period of an interventional study\n\n          . Receipt of any conventional or investigational anticancer therapy not otherwise\n             specified above within  days prior to the first dose\n\n          . Any concurrent chemotherapy, IMT, or biologic or hormonal therapy for cancer\n             treatment.\n\n          . Unresolved toxicities from prior anticancer therapy.\n\n          . Systemic therapeutic anticoagulation or daily aspirin dose exceeding  mg/per day.\n\n         . Current or prior use of immunosuppressive medication within  days prior to the first\n             dose of MEDI with exceptions as per protocol.\n\n         . History of primary immunodeficiency, solid organ transplantation, or tuberculosis\n\n         . Test results indicating active infection with human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) or\n             hepatitis B or C defined by positive serologic testing and confirmatory viral nucleic\n             acid testing\n\n         . Pregnant or breastfeeding women\n\n         . Major surgery within  weeks prior to first dose of MEDI or still recovering from\n             prior surgery.\n\n         . Other invasive malignancy within  years with the exception of protocol specified\n             criteria\n\n         . Any uncontrolled intercurent illness or condition that, in the opinion of the\n             investigator, would interfere with evaluation of the investigational product or\n             interpretation of subject safety or study results.
INCLUSION CRITERIA: -Pathologically documented, multiple myeloma relapsed or refractory\n        disease after at least  lines of therapy, -Must be willing and able to undergo bone marrow\n        biopsy at screening, -Measurable disease per the IMWG response criteria, -Eastern\n        Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status of ? , -Satisfactory hematological\n        function without transfusion or growth factor support, -Subjects should not have received\n        platelet transfusions for at least  week prior to screening, -Hemoglobin >  g/dL,\n        -Subjects may receive RBC transfusions or receive supportive care), -Other Inclusion\n        Criteria May Apply.\n\n        EXCLUSION CRITERIA: -Previously received an allogeneic stem cell transplant within  months\n        OR having received immunosuppressive therapy within the last three months OR having signs\n        or symptoms of acute or chronic graft-versus-host disease, -Autologous stem cell transplant\n        less than  days prior to study day , -Multiple myeloma with IgM subtype, -POEMS\n        syndrome, -Existing plasma cell leukemia, -Waldenstrom's macroglobulinemia, -Amyloidosis,\n        -Glucocorticoid therapy (prednisone >  mg/day or equivalent) within  days prior to\n        starting treatment, -Topical or inhaled corticosteroids are permitted, -Infection requiring\n        intravenous anti-infective treatments within  week of study enrollment (day ), -Other\n        exclusion Criteria May Apply.
Inclusion Criteria:\n\n          -  Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status of  or \n\n          -  Histologically or cytologically confirmed, Stage IV non-squamous NSCLC. Participants\n             with tumors of mixed non-small cell histology (i.e., squamous and non-squamous) are\n             eligible if the major histological component appears to be non-squamous\n\n          -  No prior treatment for Stage IV non-squamous NSCLC. Participants with a sensitizing\n             mutation in the epidermal growth factor receptor (EGFR) gene or with an anaplastic\n             lymphoma kinase (ALK) fusion oncogene are excluded. Participants with unknown EGFR and\n             ALK status require test results at screening from a local or central laboratory\n\n          -  Participants who have received prior neo-adjuvant, radiotherapy, adjuvant\n             chemotherapy, or chemoradiotherapy with curative intent for non-metastatic disease\n             must have experienced a treatment-free interval of at least  months from\n             randomization since the last dose of chemotherapy and/or radiotherapy\n\n          -  Participants should submit a pre-treatment tumor tissue sample if available before or\n             within  weeks after enrollment. If tumor tissue is not available, participants are\n             still eligible\n\n          -  For participants enrolled in the extended China enrollment phase: current resident of\n             mainland China, Hong Kong, or Taiwan and of Chinese ancestry\n\n          -  Measurable disease, as defined by RECIST v.\n\n          -  Adequate hematologic and end organ function\n\n          -  For women of childbearing potential: agreement to remain abstinent or use\n             contraceptive methods that result in a failure rate of less than (<)  percent (%) per\n             year during the treatment period and for at least  months after the last dose of\n             atezolizumab or  months after the last dose of cisplatin\n\n          -  For men: agreement to remain abstinent or use contraceptive measures and agreement to\n             refrain from donating sperm\n\n        Exclusion Criteria:\n\n        Cancer-Specific Exclusions\n\n          -  Participants with a sensitizing mutation in the EGFR gene or an ALK fusion oncogene\n\n          -  Active or untreated central nervous system (CNS) metastases as determined by computed\n             tomography (CT) or magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) evaluation during screening and\n             prior radiographic assessments\n\n          -  Spinal cord compression not definitively treated with surgery and/or radiation or\n             previously diagnosed and treated spinal cord compression without evidence that disease\n             has been clinically stable for greater than or equal to (>= ) weeks prior to\n             randomization\n\n          -  Leptomeningeal disease\n\n          -  Uncontrolled tumor-related pain\n\n          -  Uncontrolled or symptomatic hypercalcemia (greater than [>] . millimole/Liter\n             ionized calcium or calcium > milligrams/deciliter or corrected serum calcium >upper\n             limit of normal)\n\n          -  Malignancies other than NSCLC within  years prior to randomization\n\n          -  Known tumor programmed death-ligand  (PD-L) expression status from other clinical\n             studies (e.g., participants whose PD-L expression status was determined during\n             screening for entry into a study with anti-PD- or anti-PD L antibodies but were not\n             eligible are excluded)\n\n        General Medical Exclusions:\n\n          -  History of severe allergic, anaphylactic, or other hypersensitivity reactions to\n             chimeric or humanized antibodies or fusion proteins\n\n          -  History of certain autoimmune disease\n\n          -  History of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, organizing pneumonia, drug-induced\n             pneumonitis, idiopathic pneumonitis, or evidence of active pneumonitis\n\n          -  All participants will be tested for human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) prior to the\n             inclusion into the study and HIV-positive participants will be excluded from the\n             clinical study\n\n          -  Severe infections within  weeks prior to randomization\n\n          -  Significant cardiovascular disease, such as New York Heart Association cardiac disease\n             (Class II or greater), myocardial infarction or cerebrovascular accident within \n             months prior to randomization, unstable arrhythmias, or unstable angina\n\n          -  Illness or condition that may interfere with a participant's capacity to understand,\n             follow, and/or comply with study procedures\n\n        Exclusion Criteria Related to Medications and Chemotherapy:\n\n          -  Prior treatment with EGFR inhibitors or ALK inhibitors\n\n          -  Any approved anti-cancer therapy, including hormonal therapy within  days prior to\n             initiation of study treatment\n\n          -  Prior treatment with cluster of differentiation  (CD) agonists or immune\n             checkpoint blockade therapies, anti-PD-, and anti-PD-L therapeutic antibodies\n\n          -  Treatment with systemic immunostimulatory agents within  weeks prior to randomization\n\n          -  Treatment with systemic immunosuppressive medications\n\n        Exclusion Criteria Related to Chemotherapy:\n\n          -  History of allergic reactions to cisplatin, carboplatin, or other platinum-containing\n             compounds\n\n          -  Participants with hearing impairment (cisplatin)\n\n          -  Grade >= peripheral neuropathy as defined by National Cancer Institute Common\n             Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (NCI CTCAE) version . criteria (cisplatin)\n\n          -  Creatinine clearance (CRCL) < milliliters/minute (mL/min) for cisplatin or <\n             mL/min for carboplatin

Receipt of live, attenuated vaccine within  days prior to study entry.\n\n         . Receipt of any systemic anticancer therapy not mentioned above within the last  weeks\n             or  half-lives\n\n         . Subjects with CTCL, must not have had prior therapy with Imiquimod, total body\n             electron beam radiation, investigational drugs or treatments within  weeks. They must\n             not have had prior therapy with local radiation, UBV therapy, PUVA, any topical\n             chemotherapy, photopheresis, systemic retinoids, corticosteroids, immune response\n             modifiers, IFN inducers, chemotherapeutic agents or biological agents or any topical\n             treatment within  weeks. They must not have a known history or positive test for\n             infection with HTLV-.\n\n         . Cognitive disorder such that informed consent cannot be obtained directly from the\n             subject\n\n         . Subjects who have previously participated in this study and received MEDI.\n\n         . Subjects who have received prior TLR agonists, both systemic and topical.\n\n         . Patients who have received prior therapeutic radiation within  days of dosing. All\n             toxicities from prior radiotherapy must have resolved to ? Grade  or baseline prior\n             to dosing.
Inclusion Criteria:\n\n          . Written informed consent in accordance with federal, local, and institutional\n             guidelines.\n\n          . Age ?  years at the time of informed consent\n\n          . Histologically confirmed diagnosis, measurable disease and evidence of disease\n             progression of MM, as described below.\n\n          . Symptomatic MM, based on IMWG guidelines. Patients must have measurable disease as\n             defined by at least one of the following:\n\n               . Serum M-protein ? . g/dL by serum protein electrophoresis (SPEP) or, for IgA\n                  myeloma, by quantitative IgA\n\n               . Urinary M-protein excretion at least  mg/ hours\n\n               . Serum FLC ?  mg/L, provided that FLC ratio is abnormal\n\n               . If serum protein electrophoresis is felt to be unreliable for routine M-protein\n                  measurement (e.g., for IgA MM), then quantitative Ig levels by nephelometry or\n                  turbidometry are acceptable.\n\n          . Any non-hematological toxicities (except for peripheral neuropathy as described in\n             exclusion criterion #) that patients experienced from treatments in previous\n             clinical studies must have resolved to ? Grade  by Cycle  Day .\n\n          . Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) Performance Status of ? .\n\n          . Adequate hepatic function within  days prior to C D:\n\n               -  For SPd and SRd: Total bilirubin < x ULN (except patients with Gilbert's\n                  syndrome [hereditary indirect hyperbilirubinemia] who must have a total bilirubin\n                  of ? x ULN) and both AST and ALT < .x ULN)\n\n               -  For SVd, SPVd and SDd): Total bilirubin of ? .x ULN (except patients with\n                  Gilbert's syndrome [hereditary indirect hyperbilirubinemia] who must have a total\n                  bilirubin of ? x ULN) and both AST and ALT < .x ULN)\n\n          . Adequate renal function within  days prior to C D:\n\n               -  Estimated creatinine clearance of (calculated using the formula of Cockroft and\n                  Gault):\n\n               -  ?  mL/min for SVd, SPVd, and SDd Arms\n\n               -  ?  mL/min for SPd Arm (as requested by the manufacturer)\n\n               -  >  mL/min for SRd Arm\n\n          . Adequate hematopoietic function within  days prior to C D: total white blood cell\n             (WBC) count ? ,/mm, ANC ? /mm, hemoglobin (Hb) ? . g/dL, and platelet\n             count ? ,/mm. For expansion cohorts only, platelet counts > ,/mm; for\n             patients in whom ? % of bone marrow nucleated cells are plasma cells, platelets or ?\n             ,/mm are acceptable for expansion cohorts. Patients receiving hematopoietic\n             growth factor support, including erythropoietin (EPO), darbepoetin, granulocyte-colony\n             stimulating factor (G-CSF), granulocyte macrophagecolony stimulating factor (GM-CSF),\n             and platelet stimulators (e.g., eltrombopag or romiplostim) may continue to do so.\n             However, patients in the escalation cohorts must be platelet transfusion independent\n             for >  week in order to be enrolled in the study.\n\n         . Female patients of child-bearing potential must agree to use dual methods of\n             contraception and have a negative serum pregnancy test at Screening. Male patients\n             must use an effective barrier method of contraception if sexually active with a female\n             of child-bearing potential. Acceptable methods of contraception are condoms with\n             contraceptive foam, oral, implantable or injectable contraceptives, contraceptive\n             patch, intrauterine device, diaphragm with spermicidal gel, or a sexual partner who is\n             surgically sterilized or post-menopausal. For both male and female patients, effective\n             methods of contraception must be used throughout the study and for three months\n             following the last dose.\n\n             SPd (Arm ) Only:\n\n         . Relapsed and refractory MM with:\n\n               . Documented evidence of PD after achieving at least SD for ?  cycle during a\n                  previous MM regimen (i.e., relapsed MM)\n\n               . ? % response (i.e., patients never achieved ? MR) or PD during or within \n                  days from the end of the most recent MM regimen (i.e., refractory MM)\n\n               . Previously undergone ?  cycles of lenalidomide and a proteasome inhibitor (in\n                  separate therapeutic regimens [not for maintenance] or in combination)\n\n               . In the expansion arm at RPD, patients must not be pomalidomide refractory\n\n             SVd (Arm ) Only:\n\n         . Relapsed or refractory MM with\n\n               . Documented evidence of relapse after ?  previous line of therapy\n\n               . Not refractory to bortezomib in their most recent line of therapy\n\n             SRd in RRMM (Arm ) Only:\n\n         . Patients who received ?  prior therapeutic regimen (prior lenalidomide is allowed as\n             long as patient's MM was not refractory to prior lenalidomide; patients whose MM was\n             refractory to lenalidomide maintenance regimens will be allowed in this cohort).\n\n             SPVd (Arm ) Only:\n\n         . Patients whose MM is relapsing after ?  prior therapy with progression on their last\n             therapy.\n\n             SDd (Arm ) Only:\n\n         . Patients who received ?  prior lines of therapy, including a PI and an IMiD, or\n             patients with MM refractory to both a PI and an IMiD.\n\n         . Patients must not have received prior daratumumab therapy (Cohort . ONLY - dose\n             expansion at RPD).\n\n             SKd (Arm ) Only:\n\n         . Patients may have received prior bortezomib or carfilzomib therapy, however their MM\n             must NOT be refractory to carfilzomib.\n\n             SRd in NDMM (Arm ) Only:\n\n         . Patients must have symptomatic myeloma per IMWG guidelines with either CRAB criteria\n             or Myeloma Defining Events and need systemic therapy.\n\n         . No prior systemic therapy for NDMM is permitted other than pulse dose dexamethasone\n             (maximum dose of  mg).\n\n        Exclusion Criteria:\n\n        Patients meeting any of the following exclusion criteria are not eligible to enroll in this\n        study:\n\n          . Smoldering MM\n\n          . MM that does not express M-protein or FLC (i.e., non-secretory MM is excluded), and\n             quantitative immunoglobulin levels cannot be used instead\n\n          . Documented active systemic amyloid light chain amyloidosis\n\n          . Active plasma cell leukemia\n\n          . Blood (or blood product) transfusions and blood growth factors within  days of CD\n             (only for patients enrolling into the Expansion Phase)\n\n          . Radiation, chemotherapy, or immunotherapy or any other anticancer therapy ?  weeks\n             prior to CD, and radio-immunotherapy within  weeks prior to CD. Patients on\n             long-term glucocorticoids during Screening do not require a washout period. Prior\n             radiation is permitted for treatment of fractures or to prevent fractures as well as\n             for pain management\n\n          . Patients with history of SCC with residual paraplegia (Dose Escalation Phase only).\n\n          . Treatment with an investigational anti-cancer therapy within  weeks prior to CD\n\n          . Prior autologous stem cell transplantation <  month, or allogeneic stem cell\n             transplantation <  months prior to CD\n\n         . Active graft versus host disease after allogeneic stem cell transplantation\n\n         . Life expectancy <  months\n\n         . Major surgery within  weeks prior to CD\n\n         . Active, unstable cardiovascular function:\n\n               . Symptomatic ischemia, or\n\n               . Uncontrolled clinically-significant conduction abnormalities (e.g., patients with\n                  ventricular tachycardia on antiarrhythmics are excluded; patients with st degree\n                  atrioventricular (AV) block or asymptomatic left anterior fascicular block/right\n                  bundle branch block (LAFB/RBBB) will not be excluded), or\n\n               . Congestive heart failure (CHF) of New York Heart Association (NYHA) Class ? , or\n\n               . Myocardial infarction (MI) within  months prior to CD\n\n               . Ejection fraction (EF) < % at Screening\n\n         . Uncontrolled active hypertension\n\n         . Uncontrolled active infection requiring parenteral antibiotics, antivirals, or\n             antifungals within one week prior to first dose\n\n         . Known active hepatitis A, B or C\n\n         . Known HIV infection or HIV seropositivity\n\n         . Any active gastrointestinal dysfunction that prevents the patient from swallowing\n             tablets or interferes with absorption of study treatment\n\n         . Currently pregnant or breastfeeding\n\n         . A serious psychiatric or medical condition which, in the opinion of the Investigator,\n             could interfere with treatment\n\n         . Hypersensitivity to any of the treatments for the Arm in which the patient is enrolled\n\n         . In the SVd (Arm ) only: Prior history of neuropathy Grade > , or Grade  neuropathy\n             with pain at screening (within  days prior to CD)\n\n         . Prior exposure to a SINE compound, including selinexor
Inclusion Criteria:\n\n        For Advanced GI Malignancies (Dose Escalation and MTD Cohorts):\n\n          . Advanced histologically proven GI cancer.\n\n          . First line or progressive disease if already treated with any form of therapy,\n             including but not limited to chemotherapy, radiotherapy, local therapy, surgery or\n             immuno-therapy. Patients with HCC who failed sorafenib, with documented PD or AEs that\n             resulted in discontinuance of that agent. Patients with pancreatic cancer (dose\n             escalation only) who have progressed following a gemcitabine based regimen. Subjects\n             failing prior platinum containing regimens are eligible. Gastric cancer subjects that\n             express tumor HER- amplification must be treated with trastuzumab prior to\n             enrollment, unless trastuzumab is not available for those indications in a particular\n             country.\n\n          . Measurable disease using RECIST . criteria (Appendix A). At least  measurable\n             lesion must be present. Subjects who have received local-regional therapy such as (but\n             not limited to) chemoembolization, embolization, cryoablation, hepatic artery therapy,\n             percutaneous ethanol injection, radiation therapy, radiofrequency ablation or surgery\n             are eligible, provided that they have either a target lesion which has not been\n             treated with local therapy and/or the target lesion(s) within the field of the local\n             regional therapy has shown an increase of ? % in size. Local-regional therapy must\n             be completed at least  weeks prior to the baseline CT scan.\n\n          . ECOG performance status of  - .\n\n          . Expected survival of at least  months.\n\n        For HCC (Dose Escalation and MTD Expansion):\n\n        . Prior treatment with sorafenib, with documented PD or AEs that resulted in\n        discontinuance of that agent. Patient may have been treated with other lines off therapy as\n        well excluding ADI-PEG .\n\n        . Cirrhotic status of Child-Pugh grade A. Child-Pugh status should be determined based on\n        clinical findings and laboratory data during the screening period (Appendix C). Subjects on\n        Coumadin anti-coagulants are to receive only  point for their INR status.\n\n        . Serum albumin level ? . g/dl. . Prothrombin time (PT)-international normalized\n        ratio (INR): PT < seconds above control or INR <.. Subjects on Coumadin anti-coagulants\n        are to receive only  point for their INR status.\n\n        . Subjects with active hepatitis B or C on anti-viremic compounds may remain on such\n        treatment, except for interferon.\n\n        Exclusion Criteria:\n\n          . Serious infection requiring treatment with systemically administered antibiotics at\n             the time of study entrance, or an infection requiring systemic antibiotic therapy\n             within  days prior to the first dose of study treatment.\n\n          . Pregnancy or lactation.\n\n          . Expected non-compliance.\n\n          . Uncontrolled intercurrent illness including, but not limited to, ongoing or active\n             infection, symptomatic congestive heart failure (New York Heart Association Class III\n             or IV), cardiac arrhythmia, or psychiatric illness, social situations that would limit\n             compliance with study requirements.\n\n          . Subjects who have had any anticancer treatment prior to entering the study and have\n             not recovered to baseline (except alopecia) or ? Grade  AEs, or deemed irreversible\n             from the effects of prior cancer therapy. AEs > Grade  that are not considered a\n             safety risk by the Sponsor and investigator may be allowed upon agreement with both.
Inclusion Criteria\n\n        Each patient must meet all of the following inclusion criteria to be enrolled in the study:\n\n        Phase b and Phase \n\n          . Advanced or metastatic breast cancer.\n\n          . Histological or cytological confirmation of ER+ status (defined as > % positive tumor\n             cells), and histological or cytological confirmation of HER-negative (HER-) status\n             by local laboratory testing using criteria in the American Society of Oncology\n             (ASCO)/College of American Pathologists (CAP) Clinical Practice Guideline update.[]\n\n          . Female patients  years of age or older who:Are postmenopausal for at least  year\n             before the Screening visit, where menopause is defined by: Age ?  years and  year\n             or more of amenorrhea\n\n             Age <  years and  year or more of amenorrhea, with an estradiol assay <  pg/mL\n             oSurgical menopause with bilateral oophorectomy\n\n             Note: Ovarian radiation or treatment with a luteinizing hormone-releasing hormone\n             agonist (goserelin acetate or leuprolide acetate) is not permitted for induction of\n             ovarian suppression.\n\n          . Patients who have a history of brain metastasis are eligible for the study provided\n             that all the following criteria are met:\n\n               -  Brain metastases which have been treated\n\n               -  No evidence of disease progression for ?  months or hemorrhage after treatment\n\n               -  Off-treatment with dexamethasone for  weeks before administration of the first\n                  dose of MLN\n\n               -  No ongoing requirement for dexamethasone or anti-epileptic drugs\n\n          . Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status  to .\n\n          . Clinical laboratory values as specified below within  weeks before the first dose of\n             MLN:\n\n               -  Bone marrow reserve consistent with absolute neutrophil count (ANC) ? . x\n                  ^/L; platelet count ?  x ^/L; hemoglobin ?  g/dL\n\n               -  Total bilirubin ? . x the upper limit of the normal range (ULN), aspartate\n                  aminotransferase (AST) and alanine aminotransferase (ALT) ? . x ULN (?  x ULN\n                  if liver metastases are present)\n\n               -  Creatinine clearance ?  mL/min based either on Cockcroft-Gault estimate or\n                  based on a - or -hour urine collection\n\n               -  Fasting serum glucose ?  mg/dL and fasting triglycerides ?  mg/dL\n\n          . Left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) within  absolute percentage points of\n             institutional standard of normal as measured by echocardiogram (ECHO) or multiple\n             gated acquisition scan (MUGA) within  weeks before the first dose of MLN (ie, if\n             the institutional standard of normal is %, LVEF may be as low as % to be eligible\n             for the study).\n\n          . Able to provide paraffin blocks or a minimum of  unstained slides of available\n             archival tumor tissues (paraffin blocks are preferred). If archival tumor tissue is\n             not available, a tumor biopsy may be performed before the patient begins treatment\n             with MLN. If fewer than  slides are available or the tumor content/area\n             requirements are not met, study eligibility will be determined upon discussion with\n             the sponsor.\n\n          . Ability to swallow oral medications, willingness to perform mucositis prophylaxis, and\n             suitable venous access for the study-required blood sampling.\n\n         . Voluntary written consent must be given before the performance of any study related\n             procedure not part of standard medical care, with the understanding that consent may\n             be withdrawn by the patient at any time without prejudice to future medical care.\n\n             Phase b Only: In addition to the previously mentioned inclusion criteria, each\n             patient must meet the following inclusion criterion to be enrolled in the phase b\n             portion of the study:\n\n         . Patients may have SD or disease progression during their most recent treatment with\n             exemestane or fulvestrant, or everolimus in combination with either exemestane (any\n             country) or fulvestrant (US only). Exemestane or fulvestrant in combination with\n             MLN can also be initiated as a new line of therapy.\n\n             Phase  Only: In addition to the previously mentioned inclusion criteria, each patient\n             must meet all of the following inclusion criteria to be enrolled in the phase \n             portion of the study:\n\n         . Measureable disease defined as follows:\n\n               -  At least  extra-osseous lesion that can be accurately measured in at least \n                  dimension. The lesion must measure ?  mm with conventional imaging techniques\n                  or ?  mm with spiral CT or MRI, or\n\n               -  Bone lesions (lytic or mixed [lytic plus sclerotic]) in the absence of measurable\n                  disease as defined above\n\n         . Patients must have had disease progression during treatment with everolimus in\n             combination with either exemestane (any country) or fulvestrant (US only) (duration of\n             treatment ?  weeks) and must have tolerated everolimus treatment in combination with\n             exemestane (any country) or fulvestrant (US only) adequately according to the treating\n             physician's judgment. Everolimus in combination with exemestane or fulvestrant is not\n             required to be the most recent treatment before enrollment, but progression on the\n             most recent anticancer therapy is required for enrollment.\n\n        Exclusion Criteria\n\n        Patients meeting any of the following exclusion criteria are not to be enrolled in the\n        study:\n\n        Phase b and Phase \n\n          . Prior anticancer therapy or other investigational therapy within  weeks before\n             administration of the first dose of MLN (except for exemestane or fulvestrant,\n             which should be continued). Treatment with everolimus must be discontinued  weeks\n             before administration of the first dose of MLN.\n\n          . Chronic concomitant therapy with bisphosphonates or denosumab for the prevention of\n             bone metastases. Concomitant treatment with bisphosphonates or denosumab is permitted\n             for treatment of osteoporosis or management of existing bone metastases if initiated\n             at least  weeks before administration of the first dose of MLN.\n\n          . Initiation of treatment with hematopoietic growth factors, transfusions of blood and\n             blood products, or systemic corticosteroids (either IV or oral steroids, excluding\n             inhalers) within  week before administration of the first dose of MLN (patients\n             already receiving erythropoietin on a chronic basis for ?  weeks are eligible).\n\n          . Previous treatment with dual PIK/mTOR inhibitors or TORC/ inhibitors.\n\n          . Manifestations of malabsorption due to prior gastrointestinal (GI) surgery, GI\n             disease, or for an unknown reason that may alter the absorption of MLN.\n\n          . Poorly controlled diabetes mellitus defined as glycosylated hemoglobin (HbAc) > %;\n             patients with a history of transient glucose intolerance due to corticosteroid\n             administration may be enrolled in this study if all other inclusion/exclusion criteria\n             are met.\n\n          . Other clinically significant co-morbidities, such as uncontrolled pulmonary disease,\n             active central nervous system disease, active infection, or any other condition that\n             could compromise participation of the patient in the study.\n\n          . Known human immunodeficiency virus infection.\n\n          . History of any of the following within the last  months before administration of the\n             first dose of MLN:\n\n               -  Ischemic myocardial event, including angina requiring therapy and artery\n                  revascularization procedures\n\n               -  Ischemic cerebrovascular event, including transient ischemic attack and artery\n                  revascularization procedures\n\n               -  Requirement for inotropic support (excluding digoxin) or serious (uncontrolled)\n                  cardiac arrhythmia (including atrial flutter/fibrillation, ventricular\n                  fibrillation, or ventricular tachycardia)\n\n               -  Placement of a pacemaker for control of rhythm\n\n               -  New York Heart Association Class III or IV heart failure\n\n               -  Pulmonary embolism\n\n         . Significant active cardiovascular or pulmonary disease before administration of the\n             first dose of MLN, including:\n\n               -  Uncontrolled hypertension (ie, systolic blood pressure >  mm Hg; diastolic\n                  blood pressure >  mm Hg)\n\n               -  Pulmonary hypertension\n\n               -  Uncontrolled asthma or oxygen saturation < % by arterial blood gas analysis or\n                  pulse oximetry on room air\n\n               -  Significant valvular disease; severe regurgitation or stenosis by imaging\n                  independent of symptom control with medical intervention; or history of valve\n                  replacement\n\n               -  Medically significant (symptomatic) bradycardia\n\n               -  History of arrhythmia requiring an implantable cardiac defibrillator\n\n               -  Baseline prolongation of the rate-corrected QT interval (QTc; eg, repeated\n                  demonstration of QTc interval >  ms, or history of congenital long QT\n                  syndrome, or torsades de pointes)\n\n         . Diagnosed or treated for another malignancy within  years before administration of\n             the first dose of MLN or previously diagnosed with another malignancy and have any\n             evidence of residual disease. Patients with nonmelanoma skin cancer or carcinoma in\n             situ of any type are not excluded if they have undergone complete resection.\n\n             Phase b Only: In addition to the previously mentioned exclusion criteria, patients\n             meeting the following exclusion criterion are not to be enrolled in the phase b\n             portion of the study:\n\n         . More than  prior chemotherapy regimens for locally advanced or metastatic disease.\n\n             Phase  Only: In addition to the previously mentioned exclusion criteria, patients\n             meeting the following exclusion criterion are not to be enrolled in the phase \n             portion of the study:\n\n         . More than  prior chemotherapy regimen for locally advanced or metastatic disease.
Inclusion Criteria:\n\n        Key Inclusion Criteria:\n\n        Subjects must meet all of the following criteria to be included:\n\n          . Male aged between  and  years (inclusive) with histologically documented\n             clinically localized, adenocarcinoma of the prostate.\n\n          . Subject with clinical stage T or T with Gleason score of  or  (+ or +).\n\n          . At least one () MRI evaluable tumor with volume of  mm or greater.\n\n          . At least total of  mm of cancer tissue based on an MRI guided -core biopsy.\n\n          . Recent (?  months prior to study entry) negative bone scan and computerized\n             tomography (CT) scan of abdomen/pelvis.\n\n          . Life expectancy of at least  years.\n\n          . Subjects should have adequate bone marrow function defined as an absolute peripheral\n             granulocyte count ? , and platelet count of ? ,, adequate hepatic function\n             with a bilirubin ? . mg/dl and serum glutamic-pyruvic transaminase (SGPT) < x the\n             upper limits of normal, adequate renal function defined as serum creatinine ? .\n             mg/dl\n\n          . Subjects must have a coagulation profile (prothrombin time [PT], partial\n             thromboplastin time [PTT]) not more than -times the upper limit of normal and no\n             history of substantial non-iatrogenic bleeding diatheses. Use of anticoagulants within\n             -days of the Ad-SGE-REIC/Dkk- injections is limited to local use only (for control\n             of central line patency).\n\n          . Subject is willing to refrain from sexual activity or agrees to use a barrier\n             contraceptive device (e.g. condom) for -weeks after treatment with\n             Ad-SGE-REIC/Dkk-.\n\n         . Subjects must sign an informed consent indicating that they are aware of the\n             investigational nature of the study.\n\n        Key Exclusion Criteria\n\n        Subjects meeting any of the following criteria will be excluded:\n\n          . Prior primary radiation treatment to the prostate.\n\n          . Severe bladder outlet obstructive disorder (AUA >) or urinary track retention.\n\n          . Chemotherapy, immunotherapy or other investigational study drug within the past \n             weeks.\n\n          . Unable to tolerate TRUS.\n\n          . Subjects with uncontrolled cardiac, hepatic, renal or neurologic/psychiatric\n             disorders, that in the opinion of the investigator put the subject at significant\n             risk, are not eligible.\n\n          . Subjects who are HIV positive or have active hepatitis B or C infections are not\n             eligible.\n\n          . Subjects with a clinical history of primary or secondary immunodeficiency, autoimmune\n             disease or subjects taking immunosuppressive drugs such as corticosteroids\n             continuously for >  months [>  mg hydrocortisone/day] are ineligible.\n\n          . As a result of medical review, physical examination, the Principal Investigator (or\n             medically qualified nominee) considers the subject unfit for the study.
Inclusion Criteria:\n\n        Arms  and  Participants:\n\n          -  Has any histologically or cytologically confirmed advanced/metastatic solid tumor by\n             pathology report and has received, or have been intolerant to all treatment known to\n             confer clinical benefit. Solid tumors and lymphomas of any type are eligible for\n             enrollment. For cutaneous T-cell lymphoma (CTCL), histopathological diagnosis should\n             be confirmed in a skin biopsy representative of disease.\n\n          -  Have Stage III or Stage IV disease that is not surgically resectable. Stage IIB\n             (TNMB-) CTCL participants are eligible.\n\n        Arm  Participants:\n\n        -Has metastatic liver and/or liver lesion involvement that does not exceed one third of the\n        total liver volume in participants to be treated by liver IT injection. Hepatocellular\n        carcinoma participants are excluded from eligibility of IT liver injection.\n\n        All Participants:\n\n          -  Stage III or Stage IV disease that is not surgically resectable.\n\n          -  Has ? injectable lesion that is amenable to injection and biopsy via visual\n             inspection for a cutaneous lesion, or via ultrasound guidance for a subcutaneous\n             lesion.\n\n          -  Has ? discrete, distant noninjected lesion that is amenable to biopsy via visual\n             inspection or amenable to biopsy via image guidance.\n\n          -  Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) Performance Status of  or .\n\n          -  Demonstrates adequate organ function.\n\n          -  If of childbearing potential, must agree to use adequate contraception during the\n             treatment period and for at least  days after the last dose of study treatment.\n\n        Exclusion Criteria:\n\n          -  History of a second malignancy, unless potentially curative treatment has been\n             completed, with no evidence of malignancy for  years (except for successful\n             definitive resection of basal cell carcinoma of the skin, superficial bladder cancer,\n             or in situ cervical cancer).\n\n          -  Clinically active central nervous system metastases and/or carcinomatous meningitis.\n\n          -  Severe hypersensitivity reaction to treatment with a monoclonal antibody (mAb).\n\n          -  Active autoimmune disease that has required systemic treatment in the past  years.\n\n          -  History of vasculitis.\n\n          -  Active infection requiring therapy.\n\n          -  History of (noninfectious) pneumonitis that required steroids or current pneumonitis.\n\n          -  Undergone prior allogeneic hematopoietic stem cell transplantation within the last \n             years.\n\n          -  Known human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) and/or Hepatitis B or C infection.\n\n          -  Pregnant or breastfeeding, or expecting to conceive or father children within the\n             projected duration of the study.\n\n          -  Not fully recovered from any effects of major surgery, and is free of significant\n             detectable infection.\n\n          -  Had chemotherapy, definitive radiation, or biological cancer therapy within  weeks (\n             weeks for palliative radiation) prior to the first dose of study treatment, or has not\n             recovered to baseline or Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) Grade\n              from the AEs due to cancer therapeutics administered > weeks earlier.\n\n          -  Been treated within  weeks of Cycle  Day with any of the following: strong/moderate\n             Cytochrome P C (CYPC) inhibitors, such as: amiodarone, felbamate, fluconazole,\n             miconazole, piperine, oxandrolone, fluorouracil and its derivatives (combination drug\n             tegafur/gimeracil/oteracil [TS-], Uftoral [UFT], tegafur, carmofur, doxifluridine,\n             capecitabine), sulfaphenazole, cyclosporine, bucurol, tienilic acid; UGTA inhibitors\n             (including ritonavir, quinidine, probenecid, and valproic acid); or strong carbonyl\n             reductase (CBR) inhibitors (including quercetin, menadione, glycyrrhetinic acid, and\n             flufenamic acid).\n\n          -  Currently participating and receiving study therapy or has participated in a study of\n             an investigational agent and has received study therapy or has used an investigational\n             device within  days of administration of MK .\n\n          -  Expected to require any other form of antineoplastic therapy while on study.\n\n          -  On chronic systemic steroid therapy in excess of replacement doses (prednisone ?\n             mg/day is acceptable), or on any other form of immunosuppressive medication. For CTCL,\n             continued use of either prednisone ? mg/day or continued use of topical steroids is\n             acceptable.\n\n          -  Received a live vaccine within  days prior to first dose.\n\n          -  Been treated with a stimulator of interferon genes (STING) agonist (eg, MK-,\n             ADU-S [synthetic cyclic dinucleotide (CDN)]).\n\n          -  Has a history of re-irradiation for SCCHN at the projected injection site.\n\n          -  Has a tumor(s) in direct contact or encases a major blood vessel and has ulceration\n             and/or fungation onto the skin surface at the projected injection site.
Inclusion Criteria:\n\n          -  Disease Related\n\n               -  Patients must have documented history of histologically confirmed solid tumors\n                  (as defined by ASCO/CAP guidelines) originating in breast, pancreas, prostate,\n                  lung, colon, esophagus, liver, or ovary, and lymphomas, which are locally\n                  advanced or metastatic and who are refractory or intolerant beyond primary\n                  treatment for their malignancy, or for lymphoma patients who are not eligible for\n                  or who have refused autologous or allogenic hematopoietic stem cell transplant\n\n               -  Measurable or evaluable disease documented within one month of the planned\n                  protocol treatment (Treatment Period Cycle , Day )first dose of study drug (PK\n                  Period Day )\n\n               -  ECOG performance score of  and \n\n               -  Able to swallow capsules/tablets\n\n        Demographic  Male and females who are  years or older\n\n        Laboratory Values\n\n          -  Hemoglobin ? . g/dL\n\n          -  Prothrombin time (PT)/International Normalized Ratio (INR) and partial thromboplastin\n             time (PPT) ? . times the upper limit of normal\n\n          -  Serum sodium, potassium, magnesium, calcium and phosphorous levels within\n             institutional normal limits; supplements required to maintain normal electrolyte\n             levels will be permitted\n\n        Ethical\n\n         Before any study-specific procedure, the appropriate written informed consent must be\n        obtained\n\n        Exclusion Criteria:\n\n        Disease Related\n\n          -  Clinical or radiographical evidence of active brain metastasis\n\n          -  Patients who have not recovered to ? grade  toxicities except grade  alopecia or\n             neuropathy associated with previous chemotherapy, radiotherapy, biologic, hormone or\n             prior investigational therapies.\n\n        Medications:\n\n          -  Chemotherapy or other cancer, radiation or surgical treatments within  weeks or five\n             half-lives (whichever is shorter) of the first dose of study drug (PK Period Day )\n             planned first protocol treatment (i.e., cycle  day ) or not yet recovered from\n             respective treatments\n\n          -  Patients who have had allogenic hematopoietic stem cell transplant or allogenic bone\n             marrow transplant\n\n          -  Patients who have had prior solid organ transplant\n\n          -  Patients who are on immune suppression drugs or anti-transplant rejection drugs\n\n        General:\n\n          -  History of any medical or psychiatric condition or addictive disorder, or laboratory\n             abnormality that in the opinion of the investigator, may increase the risks associated\n             with study participation or treatments that may interfere with the conduct of the\n             study or the interpretation of study results\n\n          -  Prior history of clinically significant gastrointestinal bleeding, intestinal\n             obstruction or gastrointestinal perforation within  months before planned initiation\n             of study treatment\n\n          -  Uncontrolled diabetes\n\n          -  History of long QT syndrome or clinically significant cardiac arrhythmia, other than\n             stable atrial fibrillation\n\n          -  Mean QTcF >  msec in men and mean QTcF >  msec in women at screening\n\n          -  Myocardial infarction within the previous  months before planned initiation of study\n             treatment\n\n          -  Active infection requiring intravenous antibiotics within  weeks of the first dose of\n             study drug (PK Period Day ) before planned initiation of study treatment\n\n          -  Prior history or current positive tests for hepatitis B, hepatitis C or human\n             immunodeficiency virus\n\n          -  Currently enrolled in or has not yet completed at least  days since ending other\n             investigational device or drug study before planned date of first dose, or the patient\n             is currently receiving other investigational agent(s)\n\n          -  Pregnant, planning a pregnancy or breast feeding during the study\n\n          -  Male or female not willing to use adequate contraceptive precautions during the study\n             period\n\n          -  Unwilling or unable to comply with study requirements or not available for follow-up\n             assessments\n\n          -  Any disorder that compromises the ability of the patient to give written informed\n             consent and/or to comply with study procedures.
Subjects who are able and willing to give written informed consent\n\n          -  Documented primary or secondary AML, as defined by the WHO criteria (), by\n             histopathology refractory to previous induction chemotherapy and/or relapsed after\n             achieving remission with a prior chemotherapy and who are not candidates for other\n             available therapy likely to confer clinical benefit.\n\n          -  For Phase a only: in addition to inclusion criteria  above, patients must have a\n             FLT mutation of any type\n\n          -  Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status of  to \n\n          -  In the absence of rapidly progressing disease, the interval from prior treatment to\n             time of FF-- administration should be at least  days for cytotoxic agents\n             other than hydroxyurea, at least  half-lives for non-cytotoxic agents, and  days\n             for monoclonal antibody therapies. Hydroxyurea may be continued for a maximum of \n             days from the start of FF-- dosing, through Cycle  Day , with a maximal dose\n             of  grams/day\n\n          -  Persistent chronic clinically significant toxicities from prior chemotherapy or\n             surgery must be ?Grade \n\n          -  If subject has had a hematopoietic stem cell transplant, subject must be ? days\n             post-transplant with no clinically significant GVHD requiring systemic therapy\n\n          -  Alanine aminotransferase (ALT) and/or aspartate aminotransferase (AST) ? times the\n             upper limit of normal and total bilirubin of ?.x the upper limit of normal. If total\n             bilirubin is equal to or exceeds .x the upper limit of normal, the subject can still\n             be included if direct bilirubin is ?.x the upper limit of normal\n\n          -  Calculated creatinine clearance of ? mL/min\n\n          -  Female subjects of childbearing potential and sexually mature male subjects must agree\n             to use a medically accepted method of contraception other than an oral contraceptive\n             for the duration of the study.\n\n        Exclusion Criteria:\n\n          -  Subjects diagnosed with acute promyelocytic leukemia\n\n          -  Subjects with Bcr-Abl positive leukemia (chronic myelogenous leukemia in blast crisis)\n\n          -  Subjects with clinically active CNS leukemia\n\n          -  Subjects with major surgery within  days prior to the first administration of\n             FF--\n\n          -  Subjects with radiation therapy within  days prior to the first administration of\n             FF--\n\n          -  Subjects with active malignant disease requiring therapy other than AML or\n             myelodysplastic syndrome with transformation into AML\n\n          -  Subjects with an active uncontrolled infection\n\n          -  Subjects with a medical condition, serious intercurrent illness, or other circumstance\n             that, in the Investigator's judgment, could jeopardize the subject's safety as a study\n             subject, or that could interfere with the study objectives\n\n          -  Subjects known to have human immunodeficiency virus infection, or who have active\n             hepatitis B or C infection as determined by serological testing\n\n          -  Subjects with congestive heart failure, New York Heart Association (NYHA) Class  or\n             , or subjects with a past history of congestive heart failure NYHA Class  or  and\n             in whom echocardiogram or multiple gate acquisition (MUGA) scan performed within \n             months prior to screening or at screening showed a LVEF <%\n\n          -  Female subjects who are pregnant or breast feeding\n\n          -  Subjects on -hydroxy--methylglutaryl-coenzyme A reductase inhibitors (statins) or\n             other drugs known to have muscle toxicity\n\n          -  Subjects taking strong inhibitors of CYPA will be excluded from the study unless\n             therapeutic substitution is possible\n\n          -  Subjects taking strong inducers of CYPA will be excluded from the study unless\n             therapeutic substitution is possible\n\n          -  Use of systemic immunosuppressive agents within  days prior to first dose of\n             FF-\n\n          -  Subjects taking drugs known to cause Torsades de Pointes will be excluded from the\n             study unless therapeutic substitution is possible\n\n          -  Subjects known to have long QT syndrome\n\n          -  Subjects with mean QTcF values following  ECGs conducted  minutes apart of > msec
Inclusion Criteria: All subjects\n\n          . Age ? years old.\n\n          . Confirmed malignancy at advanced or metastatic stage.\n\n          . ECOG status ? .\n\n          . Adequate bone marrow function.\n\n          . Adequate renal and hepatic function.\n\n          . Females of childbearing potential and non-sterile males must agree to use highly\n             effective methods of birth control throughout the course of study and at least up to\n              days after last dosing.\n\n          . Must have measurable or evaluable disease per RECIST [Dose escalation phase only]\n\n             Additional inclusion criteria  -  are specific to tumor types in dose expansion\n             phase:\n\n          . Ovarian cancer\n\n               . Previously received at least  line of platinum containing chemotherapy.\n\n               . No progression or recurrent disease in  months from last platinum containing\n                  regimen.\n\n          . Triple-Negative Breast Cancer\n\n             a.  -  prior platinum-containing regimen (any treatment setting) and received ? \n             prior regimens (advanced or metastatic setting).\n\n         . Prostate cancer\n\n               . Documented progressive disease.\n\n               . Chemotherapy-nave or previously received ? taxane-based regimens.\n\n               . May be pre-or post-treatment with a novel androgen receptor targeted agent.\n\n               . Completed in ?  weeks radiation or treatment with anti-androgen agents.\n\n         . Ovarian, breast and prostate cancer: If homologous recombinant deficiency (HRD) or\n             BRCA status unknown, need pre-screening for eligibility.\n\n         . Small cell lung and gastric cancer: previously received ?  prior lines of therapy.\n\n        Exclusion Criteria: All subjects\n\n          . Prior exposure to a PARP inhibitor.\n\n          . Prior chemotherapy, biologic therapy, immunotherapy or investigational agents within \n             weeks prior to start of study treatment.\n\n          . Refractory to platinum-based therapy.\n\n          . Toxicity of ? Grade  from prior therapy.\n\n          . Major surgery or significant injury ?  weeks prior to start of study treatment.\n\n          . History of other active malignancies within  years with exception of (i) adequately\n             treated in situ carcinoma of the cervix, (ii) non-melanoma skin cancer, or (iii)\n             localized adequately treated cancer with curative intent or malignancy diagnosed > \n             years ago with no evidence of disease and no treatment ?  years prior to study\n             treatment.\n\n          . Untreated leptomeningeal or brain metastasis.\n\n          . Active infection requiring systemic treatment.\n\n          . Known human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) or active viral hepatitis.\n\n         . Active, clinically significant cardiac disease or any Class  or  cardiac disease,\n             ventricular arrhythmia or CVA ?  months prior to start of treatment.\n\n         . Active, clinically significant gastrointestinal disease.\n\n         . Use of any medications or food known to be strong or moderate cytochrome P, family\n             , subfamily A (CYPA) inhibitors or strong inducers.\n\n         . Pregnant or nursing females.
Inclusion Criteria:\n\n        Subjects are eligible to be included in the study only if they meet all of the following\n        criteria:\n\n          . Subjects who are males or females ?  years of age.\n\n          . Subjects who are able to give written informed consent.\n\n          . Subjects who have a documented diagnosis of MDS according to WHO criteria.\n\n          . Subjects who have Revised International Prognostic Scoring System (IPSS-R) categories\n             of Very Low, Low- or Intermediate-risk disease. Subjects with cytogenetic failure and\n             ? % marrow blasts will be eligible.\n\n          . Subjects who meet one of the following hematologic criteria within  weeks of\n             registration (according to the IWG criteria) and as documented in prior transfusion\n             logs or weekly hematology evaluations:\n\n               -  Symptomatic anemia untransfused with hemoglobin ? . g/dL or with RBC\n                  transfusion-dependence (i.e., ?  units/month) confirmed for a minimum of  weeks\n                  before randomization.\n\n               -  Platelet counts of <  x/L\n\n               -  Absolute neutrophil count < \n\n          . Subjects with del(q) who should have failed or not be a candidate for approved\n             therapy (Lenalidomide) prior to enrolling on this study.\n\n          . Subjects must meet accepted standard criteria for treatment and have failed or not be\n             candidates for standard, accepted treatments.\n\n          . Subjects who have sufficient hepatic function, defined as bilirubin  times the upper\n             limit of normal (ULN) and alanine transaminase (ALT) and aspartate transaminase (AST)\n             levels . times ULN.\n\n          . Subjects who have sufficient renal function, defined as serum creatinine levels .\n             ULN.\n\n         . Subjects who have a performance status of  on the Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group\n             (ECOG) scale (refer to Appendix ).\n\n         . Subjects who have discontinued all previous therapies for MDS or other investigational\n             therapy for at least  days prior to study enrollment and recovered to less than\n             grade  toxicity from prior therapy.\n\n         . Subjects who are able to swallow tablets.\n\n         . Subject who are willing and able to comply with scheduled visits, treatment plans,\n             laboratory tests and procedures.\n\n         . Female subjects of childbearing potential must have a negative serum pregnancy test\n             within  days of the first administration of study drug. For the purpose of this\n             study, female subjects of childbearing potential are defined as all female subjects\n             after puberty unless they are postmenopausal for at least  year, or are surgically\n             sterile (hysterectomy or bilateral oophorectomy or tubal ligation).\n\n         . Female subjects of child bearing potential who are willing to avoid the pregnancy\n             during the duration of the study and for  days following the last dose of study\n             drug. The effects of TEW- on the developing human fetus are unknown. For this\n             reason, women of child-bearing potential and men must agree to use adequate\n             contraception (hormonal or barrier method of birth control; abstinence) prior to study\n             entry and for the duration of study participation. Should a woman become pregnant or\n             suspect she is pregnant while participating in this study, she should inform her\n             treating physician immediately.\n\n         . Subjects with QTc interval calculated according to Fridericia's formula (QTcF =\n             QT/RR.; RR = RR interval) of ?  ms for males and  ms for females on screening\n             electrocardiogram (ECG).\n\n         . Subjects must have ejection fraction more than % and no clinically significant\n             valvular dysfunction.\n\n         . Subjects must have discontinued radiotherapy at least  days with resolution of any\n             toxicity to Grade  or better prior to the start of treatment.\n\n        Exclusion Criteria:\n\n        Subjects will be excluded from the study if they meet any of the following criteria:\n\n          . Subjects who have received treatment within the last  days with a drug that has not\n             received regulatory approval for any indication at the time of study entry.\n\n          . Subjects who have moderate or severe cardiac disease:\n\n          . Subjects who have the presence of cardiac disease, including a myocardial infarction\n             within  months prior to study entry, unstable angina pectoris, New York Heart\n             Association (NYHA) Class III/IV congestive heart failure, or uncontrolled\n             hypertension.\n\n          . Subjects who have documented major electrocardiogram (ECG) abnormalities at the\n             investigator's discretion (for example, symptomatic or sustained atrial or ventricular\n             arrhythmias, second- or third-degree atrioventricular block, bundle branch blocks,\n             ventricular hypertrophy, or recent myocardial infarction).\n\n          . Subjects who have major abnormalities documented by echocardiography with Doppler (for\n             example, moderate or severe heart valve function defect and/or left ventricular\n             ejection fraction (LVEF) <%, evaluation based on the institutional lower limit of\n             normal).\n\n          . Subjects who have predisposing conditions that are consistent with development of\n             aneurysms of the ascending aorta or aortic stress (for example, family history of\n             aneurysms, Marfan-Syndrome, bicuspid aortic valve, evidence of damage to the large\n             vessels of the heart documented by CT scan with contrast).\n\n          . Subjects who have documented iron, B, folate deficiency as determined by the\n             investigator.\n\n          . Female subjects who are breastfeeding, or intend to breastfeed during the duration of\n             the study and for  days following the last dose of study drug.\n\n          . Subjects with any other serious medical condition which in the Investigator's opinion\n             would preclude safe participation in the study.\n\n         . Subjects, in the opinion of the Investigator, who are unsuitable to participate in the\n             study.\n\n         . Subjects with elevated Troponin  levels at screening or known to have persistently\n             elevated brain natriuretic peptide (BNP).\n\n         . Subjects with serious pre-existing medical conditions as follows:\n\n               -  History of cardiac or aortic surgery,\n\n               -  Hypertension that is not controlled by standard medication (to / mmHg or\n                  below),\n\n               -  Cirrhosis of the liver, Child-Pugh Stage B or C, or history of liver transplant,\n\n               -  Severe diabetes that is not currently controlled,\n\n               -  Current or history of interstitial pneumonitis,\n\n               -  Presence of aneurisms of the ascending aorta or aortic stress.\n\n         . Subjects with known history of difficulty swallowing, malabsorption or other\n             conditions that may reduce absorption of the product.\n\n         . Subjects with major abnormalities identified by ECG or echocardiogram (ECHO), at the\n             Investigator's discretion.\n\n         . Subjects with active infection with human immunodeficiency virus, hepatitis B virus or\n             hepatitis C virus.\n\n         . Subjects with active infection requiring systemic antibiotic therapy.\n\n         . Subjects who are currently using or planning to use:\n\n        Drugs which are exclusively or primarily eliminated by cytochrome P- isozyme A

Patients ? years of age, except for patients with ALL who can be ? years of age\n\n          . Morphologically documented relapsed/refractory myelodysplastic syndrome (MDS), acute\n             myeloid leukemia (AML), acute lymphocytic leukemia (ALL), and chronic lymphocytic\n             leukemia (CLL) as defined by World Health Organization (WHO) criteria\n\n          . Patients with relapsed/refractory MDS, AML, ALL must have progressed on least  prior\n             therapy and cannot be a candidate for any available therapies in patients with a\n             rationale for known to confer clinical benefit\n\n          .
