Part- Escalation Phase [Key Inclusion]:\n\n          -  Histologically or cytologically confirmed diagnosis of solid tumor malignancy or\n             lymphoma that is not responsive to standard therapies, are unfit for standard\n             chemotherapy or for which there is no approved or curative therapy.\n\n          -  ECOG score of  or .\n\n          -  Able to swallow and retain oral medication.\n\n          -  Adequate organ system function.\n\n        Part- Expansion Phase [Key Inclusion]:\n\n          -  Part- Escalation Phase inclusion criteria.\n\n          -  (a) Thymic carcinoma, thymoma, pancreatic cancer, or breast cancer (TNBC); or (b) any\n             other cancer with histologically or cytologically or genomically confirmed diagnosis\n             of NTRK (TrkA) mutation, or fusion, or overexpression, translocation, amplification\n             or other alterations that may interfere with TrkA (NTRK) signaling, as previously\n             identified with prior testing as routinely performed at Clinical Laboratory\n             Improvement Amendments (CLIA)-certified or other similarly-certified laboratories.\n\n        Part- Pharmacodynamic Activity (Eligible subjects in Part- may enroll in Part-):\n\n          -  Part- Expansion Phase inclusion criteria.\n\n          -  Tumor with readily accessible lesion that is amenable to biopsy and consent to pre-and\n             post-dose biopsy.\n\n        Key Exclusion Criteria (Part-, - and -):\n\n          . Received chemotherapy having delayed toxicity within the last  days (six weeks for\n             prior nitrosourea or mitomycin C).\n\n          . Received anticancer therapy with radiation, immunotherapy, a biologic, surgery and/or\n             tumor embolization within the past  weeks.\n\n          . Received an investigational anti-cancer drug within  days or  half-lives of the\n             investigational agent prior, whichever is shorter, to the first dose of VMD-.\n\n          . Unresolved toxicity from previous anti-cancer therapy ? CTCAE Grade  (except alopecia\n             or anemia) unless agreed to by both the Investigator and Sponsor.\n\n          . Known active infections including HIV disease.\n\n          . Currently pregnant, nursing, or planning to become pregnant during the course of the\n             study.\n\n          . QTcF interval ?  msec.\n\n          . Class II, III, or IV heart failure as defined by the New York Heart Association (NYHA)\n             functional classification system.\n\n          . Acute coronary syndromes (including unstable angina), coronary angioplasty, or\n             stenting within the past  weeks.\n\n         . Unstable or uncompensated respiratory, hepatic, renal, or cardiac disease that would\n             compromise the patient's safety or interfere with assessment of the drug.\n\n         . Psychological, familial, sociological, geographical or other concurrent conditions\n             that would interfere with safety evaluation, limit the subject's ability to follow the\n             procedures in the protocol or otherwise jeopardize compliance with the protocol.\n             Subjects with uncontrolled major depression, bipolar disorder, or severe anxiety\n             disorder are excluded.\n\n             Key Exclusion Criteria (For Part- Escalation Phase only):\n\n         . Any current medical condition that would alter the absorption, distribution,\n             metabolism or excretion of VMD- including but not limited to:\n\n               -  Severe uncontrolled nausea or vomiting\n\n               -  Severe uncontrolled diarrhea The intended population for VMD- are expected to\n                  have had bowel resections and these subjects will be eligible for Part- Dose\n                  Escalation phase.
Inclusion criteria:\n\n          -  Existence of archival or fresh tumor biopsy specimen for FGFR/ mRNA expression\n             testing\n\n          -  High FGFR or  mRNA expression levels (RNAscope score of + or +) in archival or\n             fresh tumor biopsy specimen\n\n          -  Documented locally advanced (T, any N; or any T, N-) or metastatic urothelial\n             carcinoma (transitional cell carcinoma) including urinary bladder, renal pelvis,\n             ureters, urethra, meeting all of the following criteria:\n\n          -  No prior systemic treatment for locally advanced or metastatic urothelial carcinoma.\n             For patients who received prior adjuvant/neoadjuvant chemotherapy or chemo-radiation\n             for urothelial carcinoma, a treatment-free interval >  months between the last\n             treatment administration and the date of recurrence is required in order to be\n             considered treatment-nave in the metastatic setting. Prior local intra-vesical\n             chemotherapy or prior local immunotherapy is allowed.\n\n          -  Ineligibility for cisplatin-based chemotherapy as defined by any one of the following\n             criteria:\n\n               -  Impaired renal function (GFR >  but <  mL/min/. m) according to the\n                  modification of diet in renal disease (MDRD) abbreviated formula\n\n               -  Hearing loss (measured by audiometry) of  dB at two contiguous frequencies\n\n               -  Grade ?  peripheral neuropathy (i.e. sensory alteration or paresthesia including\n                  tingling)\n\n          -  Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Performance Status (ECOG PS)  or .\n\n        Exlusion criteria:\n\n          -  Active symptomatic or untreated brain metastases as determined by CT or MRI evaluation\n             during screening and prior radiographic assessment.\n\n          -  History of autoimmune disease, including but not limited to myasthenia gravis,\n             myositis, autoimmune hepatitis, systemic lupus erythematosus, rheumatoid arthritis,\n             inflammatory bowel disease, vascular thrombosis associated with anti-phospholipid\n             syndrome, granulomatosis with polyangiitis, Sjgren's syndrome, Guillain-Barr\n             syndrome, multiple sclerosis, vasculitis, or glomerulonephritis.\n\n          -  History or current condition of an uncontrolled cardiovascular disease including any\n             of the following conditions:\n\n               -  Congestive heart failure (CHF) NYHA Class  or greater, unstable angina (symptoms\n                  of angina at rest) or\n\n               -  New-onset angina (within last  months before the first study drug\n                  administration)\n\n               -  Myocardial infarction (MI) within past  months before the first study drug\n                  administration\n\n               -  Unstable cardiac arrhythmias requiring anti-arrhythmic therapy.\n\n          -  Patients with known coronary artery disease, congestive heart failure not meeting the\n             above criteria, or known left ventricular ejection fraction < % must be on a stable\n             medical regimen that is optimized in the opinion of the treating physician, in\n             consultation with a cardiologist if appropriate.\n\n          -  Current diagnosis of any retinal disorders including retinal detachment, retinal\n             pigment epithelial detachment (RPED), serous retinopathy or retinal vein occlusion.\n\n          -  Current evidence of endocrine alteration of calcium phosphate homeostasis (e.g.\n             parathyroid disorder, history of parathyroidectomy, tumor lysis, tumoral calcinosis,\n             paraneoplastic hypercalcemia).\n\n          -  Concomitant therapies that are known to increase serum calcium or phosphate levels\n             (i.e. antacids, phosphate-containing laxatives oral/rectal, potassium phosphate) and\n             that cannot be discontinued or switched to a different medication before the first\n             study drug administration\n\n          -  Treatment with systemic corticosteroids or other systemic immunosuppressant\n             medications within  weeks before the first study drug administration, or anticipated\n             requirement for systemic immunosuppressive medications during the trial.
Inclusion Criteria Stage \n\n          -  ECOG Performance Status of  or \n\n          -  Metastatic or locally advanced, histologically documented TNBC (absence of HER, ER,\n             and PR expression)\n\n          -  Radiologic/objective evidence of recurrence or disease progression after one line of\n             chemotherapy for metastatic breast cancer MBC\n\n          -  Availability of a representative tumor specimen that is suitable for determination of\n             PD-L and/or additional biomarker status via central testing\n\n          -  Eligible for capecitabine monotherapy\n\n          -  Adequate hematologic and end-organ function, laboratory test results, obtained within\n              days prior to initiation of study treatment.\n\n          -  Negative HIV test at screening\n\n          -  Negative hepatitis B surface antigen .\n\n          -  Negative hepatitis C virus (HCV) antibody test at screening or positive HCV antibody\n             test followed by a negative HCV RNA test at screening\n\n        Inclusion Criteria for Stage  and Stage \n\n          -  Measurable disease according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors v.\n             (RECIST v.)\n\n          -  Tumor accessible for biopsy\n\n          -  For patients receiving therapeutic anticoagulation: stable anticoagulant regimen\n             during the  days prior to initiation of study treatment\n\n          -  For women of childbearing potential: agreement to remain abstinent (refrain from\n             heterosexual intercourse) or use contraceptive measures as outlined for each specific\n             treatment arm\n\n          -  For men: agreement to remain abstinent (refrain from heterosexual intercourse) or use\n             contraceptive measures, and agreement to refrain from donating sperm, as outlined for\n             each specific treatment arm\n\n        Inclusion criteria stage \n\n          -  ECOG Performance Status of , , or \n\n          -  Patients randomly allocated to the control arm during Stage : ability to initiate\n             Stage  treatment within  months after experiencing unacceptable toxicity, provided\n             that Medical Monitor approval for entry into Stage  is obtained, or disease\n             progression per RECIST v. while receiving control treatment\n\n          -  Patients randomly allocated to an experimental arm during Stage : ability to initiate\n             Stage  treatment within  months after experiencing unacceptable toxicity not related\n             to atezolizumab, disease progression per RECIST v., or loss of clinical benefit as\n             determined by the investigator (see Section ... for details) while receiving Stage\n              treatment\n\n          -  Availability of a tumor specimen from a biopsy performed upon discontinuation of Stage\n              (if deemed clinically feasible by the investigator)\n\n        Exclusion Criteria for Stage \n\n          -  Prior treatment with any of the protocol-specified study treatments\n\n          -  Treatment with investigational therapy within  days prior to initiation of study\n             treatment\n\n          -  Inability to swallow medication or malabsorption condition that would alter the\n             absorption of orally administered medications\n\n          -  Treatment with sorivudine or its chemically related analogues, such as brivudine\n\n          -  History of severe and unexpected reactions to fluoropyrimidine therapy\n\n        Exclusion Criteria for Stage  and Stage \n\n          -  Uncontrolled pleural effusion, pericardial effusion, or ascites requiring recurrent\n             drainage procedures (once monthly or more frequently)\n\n          -  Uncontrolled tumor-related pain\n\n          -  Symptomatic, untreated, or actively progressing CNS metastases\n\n          -  History of leptomeningeal disease\n\n          -  Active or history of autoimmune disease or immune deficiency\n\n          -  History of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, organizing pneumonia (e.g., bronchiolitis\n             obliterans), drug-induced pneumonitis, or idiopathic pneumonitis, or evidence of\n             active pneumonitis on screening chest computed tomography (CT) scan History of\n             radiation pneumonitis in the radiation field (fibrosis) is permitted.\n\n          -  Active tuberculosis\n\n          -  Severe infection within  weeks prior to initiation of study treatment\n\n          -  Treatment with therapeutic oral or IV antibiotics within  weeks prior to initiation\n             of study treatment\n\n          -  Significant cardiovascular disease\n\n          -  Prior allogeneic stem cell or solid organ transplantation\n\n          -  History of malignancy other than breast cancer within  years prior to screening, with\n             the exception of those with a negligible risk of metastasis or death\n\n          -  Treatment with systemic immunosuppressive medication (including, but not limited to,\n             corticosteroids, cyclophosphamide, azathioprine, methotrexate, thalidomide, and\n             anti-tumor necrosis factor alpha agents) within  weeks prior to initiation of study\n             treatment, or anticipation of need for systemic immunosuppressive medication during\n             the course of the study\n\n          -  Pregnancy or breastfeeding, or intention of becoming pregnant during the study
INCLUSION CRITERIA:\n\n          . Age: Men and women aged ?  years,\n\n          . Signed written informed consent,\n\n          . Any histologic type of locally advanced or metastatic NSCLC,\n\n          . Life expectancy of ?  weeks,\n\n          . Measurable or evaluable (cytologically or radiologically detectable disease such as\n             ascites, peritoneal deposits, or lesions which do not fulfill RECIST . criteria for\n             measurable disease) lesions according to RECIST v. criteria for phase  portion. For\n             phase , all patients must have RECIST . measurable disease,\n\n          . Physiologic function:\n\n               -  Hematologic function: Absolute neutrophil count (ANC) ? .  /L, platelet\n                  count ?   /L, and hemoglobin ?  g/dL (may have been transfused),\n\n               -  Hepatic function: Total bilirubin level ? .  the upper limit of normal (ULN)\n                  range and aspartate aminotransferase (AST) and alanine aminotransferase (ALT)\n                  levels ? .  ULN,\n\n               -  Renal function: Estimated creatinine clearance ?  mL/min according to the\n                  Cockcroft-Gault formula (or local institutional standard method).\n\n          . Pregnancy and contraception:\n\n               -  Pregnancy test: Negative serum or urine pregnancy test at screening for women of\n                  childbearing potential,\n\n               -  Contraception: Highly effective contraception for both male and female subjects\n                  throughout the study and for  days after last avelumab treatment administration\n                  if the risk of conception exists.\n\n          . Ability to comply with protocol requirements,\n\n          . Willingness to consent and ability to undergo a trucut biopsy to obtain a fresh\n             metastasis or primary tumor biopsy in case no adequate tumoral tissue is available,\n             and to undergo fibroscopy to obtain a biopsy from normal bronchial mucosa,\n\n         . No serious or medically uncontrolled concomitant conditions that are likely to make\n             the patient unfit for SPRING combination therapy, as per investigator assessment,\n\n         . Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status of  to .\n\n        EXCLUSION CRITERIA:\n\n          . Patients with documented oncogenic aberrations at enrollment: EGFR, ALK, ROS when\n             available, MET exon  skipping when available.\n\n             Note: For Phase  portion, all patients with adenocarcinoma histology must have\n             documentation of results for druggable oncogenic aberrations (EGFR mutations, ALK\n             rearrangements, and ROS when available) prior to enrollment on the study.\n\n          . For Phase  portion, > lines of prior therapy in the metastatic setting.\n\n          . For the dose escalation phase of the study or until the MTD for the combination\n             regimen has been determined, patients with moderate hepatic impairment defined as AST,\n             ALT, alkaline phosphatase (ALP) > times ULN, which would be grade  or higher.\n             However patients with liver metastases with AST/ALT ?  x ULN can be included in the\n             study.\n\n          . For Phase  portion, any prior therapy in the metastatic setting.\n\n        Clinical exclusion criteria for Phase  and Phase  studies:\n\n          . Documented untreated central nervous system metastases (indicated by clinical\n             symptoms, cerebral edema, steroid requirement, or progressive disease in the prior\n             four weeks),\n\n          . Participants with a history of myocardial infarction within the last  years or with\n             significant cardiac arrhythmias uncontrolled by medication or pacemaker,\n\n          . Participants with any history of interstitial lung disease,\n\n          . Prior clinically significant toxicities from anticancer agents or radiotherapy which\n             have not regressed to Grade ?  severity (NCI-CTCAE version .) apart from\n             peripheral neuropathy and alopecia,\n\n          . History of any second malignancy in the last two years; patients with prior history of\n             in-situ cancer or basal or squamous cell skin cancer are eligible. Patients with a\n             history of other malignancies are eligible if they have been continuously disease-free\n             for at least two years,\n\n          . Autoimmune condition requiring medical intervention,\n\n          . Uncontrolled concomitant illness, active infection requiring i.v. antibiotics,\n\n          . Participants who are at risk for, or who have a history of arterial thromboembolic\n             events within the past  months and/or venous thromboembolic events within the past \n             months, or have had any recent active gastrointestinal bleeding,\n\n          . Prior > G hemoptysis, major blood vessel involvement, and/or central cavitations,\n\n         . Known or suspected drug hypersensitivity to any drug used in the combination,\n\n         . Difficulty swallowing, malabsorption or other chronic gastrointestinal disease, or\n             conditions that may hamper compliance and/or absorption of the oral drugs,\n\n         . Any condition (e.g., known or suspected poor compliance, psychological instability,\n             geographical location, etc.) that, in the judgment of the investigator may affect the\n             patient's ability to sign the informed consent and undergo study procedures,\n\n         . Taking another experimental drugs within  days prior to day  of the protocol\n             medications in this study,\n\n         . Pregnant or breast-feeding women,\n\n         . Both male and female patients of reproductive potential must agree to use a reliable\n             method of birth control, during the study and for  months following the last dose of\n             study drug,\n\n         . Patients currently taking strong CYPA inducers and inhibitors.\n\n         . Patients currently taking proton pump inhibitors due to their impact on the\n             disposition of palbociclib during the dose escalation phase,\n\n         . Other anticancer agents and anticoagulants are excluded (except for low doses of\n             anticoagulants used for access lines)\n\n         . A time period of at least three weeks or five drug half-lives, whichever is shorter\n             must have elapsed from last non-investigational therapy before day  of treatment on\n             this study,\n\n         . Specific exclusion criteria for administration of avelumab, in combination:\n\n               -  IMMUNOSUPRESSANTS: Current use of immunosuppressive medication, EXCEPT for the\n                  following: a. intranasal, inhaled, topical steroids, or local steroid injection\n                  (e.g., intra-articular injection); b. Systemic corticosteroids at physiologic\n                  doses ?  mg/day of prednisone or equivalent; c. Steroids as premedication for\n                  hypersensitivity reactions (e.g., CT scan premedication).\n\n               -  AUTOIMMUNE DISEASE: Active autoimmune disease that might deteriorate when\n                  receiving an immuno-stimulatory agent. Patients with diabetes type I, vitiligo,\n                  psoriasis, or hypo- or hyperthyroid diseases not requiring immunosuppressive\n                  treatment are eligible.\n\n               -  ORGAN TRANSPLANTATION: Prior organ transplantation including allogenic stem-cell\n                  transplantation.\n\n               -  INFECTIONS: Active infection requiring systemic therapy.\n\n               -  HIV/AIDS: Known history of testing positive for HIV or known acquired\n                  immunodeficiency syndrome.\n\n               -  HEPATITIS: Hepatitis B virus (HBV) or hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection at\n                  screening (positive HBV surface antigen or HCV RNA if anti-HCV antibody screening\n                  test positive).\n\n               -  VACCINATION: Vaccination within  weeks of the first dose of avelumab and while\n                  on trials is prohibited except for administration of inactivated vaccines.\n\n               -  HYPERSENSITIVITY TO STUDY DRUG: Known prior severe hypersensitivity to\n                  investigational product or any component in its formulations, including known\n                  severe hypersensitivity reactions to monoclonal antibodies (NCI CTCAE v. Grade\n                  ? ).\n\n               -  CARDIOVASCULAR DISEASE: Clinically significant (i.e., active) cardiovascular\n                  disease: cerebral vascular accident/stroke (<  months prior to enrollment),\n                  myocardial infarction (<  months prior to enrollment), unstable angina,\n                  congestive heart failure (? New York Heart Association Classification Class II),\n                  or serious cardiac arrhythmia requiring medication.\n\n               -  OTHER PERSISTING TOXICITIES: Persisting toxicity related to prior therapy (NCI\n                  CTCAE v. . Grade > ); however, alopecia, sensory neuropathy Grade ? , or\n                  other Grade ?  not constituting a safety risk based on investigator's judgment\n                  are acceptable.\n\n               -  Other severe acute or chronic medical conditions including colitis, inflammatory\n                  bowel disease, pneumonitis, pulmonary fibrosis or psychiatric conditions\n                  including recent (within the past year) or active suicidal ideation or behavior;\n                  or laboratory abnormalities that may increase the risk associated with study\n                  participation or study treatment administration or may interfere with the\n                  interpretation of study results and, in the judgment of the investigator, would\n                  make the patient inappropriate for entry into this study.
PART A DOSE ESCALATION\n\n        Inclusion Criteria: PART A Dose Escalation\n\n          . - years of age\n\n          . Histologically confirmed WHO grade IV glioblastoma\n\n          . Unequivocal evidence of a tumor recurrence (any number of recurrences) or progression\n             after an initial treatment regimen (prior to enrollment on this study) consisting of\n             surgical intervention (tumor resection), radiation, and temozolomide chemotherapy (per\n             Stupp protocol), as assessed by MRI of the brain with and without contrast within \n             days prior to the initiation of injections of VBI-.\n\n          . Recovery from the effects of surgery.\n\n          . Corticosteroid (dexamethasone or equivalent) dosage ? mg daily that has been stable\n             or decreasing for at least  days.\n\n          . Recovery from prior therapy toxicity defined as resolution of all treatment-related\n             adverse events (AEs) to Grade ?  or pre-treatment baseline (except alopecia).\n\n          . Karnofsky performance status (KPS) score ? %.\n\n          . Adequate organ function, including the following:\n\n               . Absolute neutrophil count (ANC) ? ,/?L, platelets ? ,/?L\n\n               . Serum creatinine < .  the upper limit of normal (ULN)\n\n               . Bilirubin < .  ULN\n\n               . Alanine aminotransferase (ALT) and aspartate aminotransferase (AST) < .  ULN\n\n          . Women of childbearing potential: negative urine pregnancy test within  days prior to\n             the start of VBI- treatment.\n\n         . Female subjects of childbearing potential and sexually active male subjects must agree\n             to use an acceptable form of contraception for heterosexual activity (i.e., oral\n             contraceptives, double barrier methods, hormonal injectable, transdermal, or implanted\n             contraceptives, tubal ligation, or vasectomy of their sexual partner(s) for >  days\n             before Screening, during the study, and for  days after the last dose of study\n             drug).\n\n         . Female subjects without childbearing potential (spontaneous amenorrhea for >  months\n             or surgically sterilized by tubal ligation, hysterectomy, or bilateral oophorectomy >\n              months before Screening) are eligible for inclusion without contraceptive use\n             restriction.\n\n         . Able and willing to comply with protocol requirements, including being able to have an\n             MRI in the opinion of the Investigator.\n\n         . Written consent has been obtained.\n\n         . Tumor specimen available for central pathological review.\n\n        Exclusion Criteria: PART A Dose Escalation\n\n          . Contrast-enhancing residual tumor that is associated with either diffuse sub-\n             ependymal or leptomeningeal dissemination.\n\n          . Requirement of systemic corticosteroid therapy >  mg/day of dexamethasone or\n             equivalent or requirement of increasing dose of systemic corticosteroids during the \n             days prior to the start of VBI- treatment.\n\n          . Evidence of HCMV viremia in serum of > , (.Log) IU/mL using FDA approved\n             COBAS AmpliPrep/COBAS TaqMan HCMV test (Roche).\n\n          . Surgical resection or major surgical procedure within  days prior to the start of\n             VBI- , or stereotactic biopsy within  days prior to the start of VBI-.\n\n          . Active infection requiring intravenous antibiotics or antiviral.\n\n          . History of cancer (other than GBM or prostate) within the past  years that could\n             negatively impact survival and/or potentially confound tumor response assessments\n             within this study.\n\n          . Known immunosuppressive disease or active systemic autoimmune disease such as systemic\n             lupus erythematosus, human immunodeficiency virus infection, Hepatitis B virus or\n             Hepatitis C virus infections. Subjects with vitiligo, type  diabetes mellitus,\n             hypothyroidism due to autoimmune condition only requiring hormone replacement therapy,\n             psoriasis not requiring systemic therapy, or conditions not expected to recur in the\n             absence of an external trigger are permitted to enroll.\n\n          . Immunosuppressive agent within  weeks prior to the start of VBI- treatment.\n\n          . Evidence of intra-tumoral or peri-tumoral hemorrhage on baseline, other than those\n             that are ?Grade  and either post-operative or stable on at least  consecutive MRI\n             scans.\n\n         . Any condition which in the investigator's opinion makes the subject unsuitable for\n             study participation.\n\n         . Lack of family or social support structure that would preclude continued participation\n             in the study.\n\n        PART B\n\n        Inclusion Criteria: Part B\n\n          . - years of age.\n\n          . Multi-focal (defined as two separate areas of contrast enhancement measuring at\n                  least  cm in  planes that are not contiguous on either fluid-attenuated\n                  inversion recovery (FLAIR) or T sequences);\n\n               . Associated with either diffuse sub-ependymal or leptomeningeal dissemination.\n\n          . Requirement of systemic corticosteroid therapy >  mg/day of dexamethasone or\n             equivalent or requirement of increasing dose of systemic corticosteroids during the \n             days prior to the start of VBI- treatment.\n\n          . Evidence of HCMV viremia in plasma of >, (.log) IU/mL using FDA approved\n             COBAS AmpliPrep/COBAS TaqMan HCMV test (Roche).\n\n          . Prior treatment involving immunotherapy, including oncolytic viruses, therapeutic\n             vaccination, or biologics (e.g. monoclonal antibodies) presumed to have\n             immunomodulatory effects.\n\n          . Surgical resection or major surgical procedure within  days prior to the start of\n             VBI- , or stereotactic biopsy within  days prior to the start of VBI-.\n\n          . Radiation therapy, local therapy (except for surgical re-resection), or systemic\n             therapy following first recurrence/progressive disease. Excluded local therapies\n             include stereotactic radiation boost, implantation of carmustine biodegradable wafers\n             (Gliadel), intratumoral or convection- enhanced delivery administered agents, etc.\n\n          . Active infection requiring intravenous antibiotics or antivirals.\n\n          . History of cancer (other than GBM or prostate) within the past  years that has\n             metastatic or local recurrence potential and could negatively impact survival and/or\n             potentially confound tumor response assessments within this study.\n\n          . Known immunosuppressive disease or active systemic autoimmune disease such as systemic\n             lupus erythematosus, human immunodeficiency virus infection, Hepatitis B virus or\n             Hepatitis C virus infections. Subjects with vitiligo, type  diabetes mellitus,\n             hypothyroidism due to autoimmune condition only requiring hormone replacement therapy,\n             psoriasis not requiring systemic therapy, or conditions not expected to recur in the\n             absence of an external trigger are permitted to enroll.\n\n         . Immunosuppressive agent within  weeks prior to the start of VBI- treatment.\n\n         . Evidence of intra- or peri-tumoral hemorrhage on baseline MRI scan, other than those\n             that are ?Grade  and either post-operative or stable on at least  consecutive MRI\n             scans.\n\n         . Any condition which in the investigator's opinion makes the subject unsuitable for\n             study participation.\n\n         . Lack of family or social support structure that would preclude continued participation\n             in the study.
Inclusion Criteria: All subjects\n\n          . Histologically confirmed diagnosis of B-cell follicular lymphoma based on the WHO \n             classification of tumors of hematopoietic and lymphoid tissue.\n\n          . ? prior systemic treatments for follicular lymphoma.\n\n          . Previously received an anti-CD antibody and an appropriate alkylator-based\n             combination therapy.\n\n          . Disease progression within  months after completion of most recent therapy or\n             refractory disease.\n\n          . Presence of measurable disease.\n\n          . Availability of archival tissue confirming diagnosis.\n\n          . ECOG performance status of , or .\n\n          . Life expectancy ? months.\n\n          . Adequate bone marrow function.\n\n         . Adequate renal and hepatic function.\n\n         . Females of childbearing potential and non-sterile males must agree to use highly\n             effective methods of birth control throughout the course of study and at least up to\n              days after last dosing, or  months after the last dose of obinutuzumab, whichever\n             is longer.\n\n         . Male subjects are eligible if vasectomized or if they agree to the use of barrier\n             contraception in combination with other methods during the study treatment period and\n             for ?  days after the last dose of BGB-.\n\n         . Ability to provide the written informed consent and can understand and comply with the\n             requirements of the study.\n\n        Exclusion Criteria: All subjects\n\n          . Prior exposure to a BTK inhibitor.\n\n          . Known central nervous system involvement by leukemia or lymphoma.\n\n          . No evidence of transformation from follicular lymphoma to other aggressive histology.\n\n          . No allogeneic hematopoietic stem cell transplantation within  months of enrollment\n\n          . Clinically significant cardiovascular disease.\n\n          . Major surgery or significant injury ?  weeks prior to start of study treatment.\n\n          . Active fungal, bacterial or viral infection requiring systemic treatment.\n\n          . History of severe bleeding disorder.\n\n         . History of stroke or intracranial hemorrhage within  months before first study drug.\n\n         . Severe or debilitating pulmonary disease.\n\n         . Known human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) or active hepatitis B or C.\n\n         . Unable to swallow capsules or significant gastrointestinal disease that would\n             interfere with drug absorption.\n\n         . Requires ongoing treatment with a strong CYPA inhibitor or inducer\n\n         . Pregnant or nursing females.\n\n         . Vaccination with live vaccine within  days prior to first dose.\n\n         . Ongoing drug or alcohol addiction.\n\n         . Hypersensitivity to BGB-, known ingredients of BGB- or obinutuzumab.\n\n         . Participation in another therapeutic trial.
Inclusion criteria\n\n        .Provision of informed consent prior to any study specific procedures .Patients must be\n        male or female ? years of age. .Progressive cancer at the time of study entry with a\n        life expectancy of ? weeks .Histologically or cytologically confirmed TNBC with evidence\n        of metastatic disease as per ASCO-CAP HER guideline recommendations  .Patients must\n        have received at least  and no more than  prior lines of treatment for metastatic disease\n        with an anthracycline (eg, doxorubicin, epirubicin) and/or a taxane (eg, paclitaxel,\n        docetaxel) unless contraindicated, in either the neo-adjuvant, adjuvant or metastatic\n        setting.\n\n        .Confirmed presence of qualifying HRR mutation or absence of any HRR mutation in tumour\n        tissue by the Lynparza HRR assay.\n\n        .At least one measurable lesion that can be accurately assessed at baseline by computed\n        tomography (CT) (magnetic resonance imaging [MRI] where CT is contraindicated) and is\n        suitable for repeated assessment as per RECIST ..\n\n        .Patients must have normal organ and bone marrow function measured within  days prior to\n        randomisation as defined by protocol .ECOG PS - within  days of randomisation.\n        .Patients must be willing to comply with the protocol requirements Exclusion criteria\n\n          . Cytotoxic chemotherapy, hormonal or non hormonal targeted therapy within  days of\n             Cycle  Day  is not permitted. Palliative radiotherapy must have been completed  or\n             more days before Cycle  Day . The patient can receive a stable dose of\n             bisphosphonates or denosumab for bone metastases, before and during the study as long\n             as these were started at least  days prior to study treatment.\n\n          . More than  prior lines of cytotoxic chemotherapy for metastatic disease.\n\n          . Previous randomisation in the present study.\n\n          . Previous treatment with a PARP inhibitor (including olaparib) or other DDR inhibitor\n             (unless treatment was for less than  weeks duration and at least  months have\n             elapsed between the last dose and randomisation. Patients that did not tolerate prior\n             treatment are excluded).\n\n          . Exposure to a small molecule IP within  days or  half-lives (whichever is longer)\n             prior to randomisation.The minimum washout period for immunotherapy shall be  days.\n\n          . Patients with MDS/AML or with features suggestive of MDS/AML.\n\n          . Patients with second primary cancer, EXCEPTIONS: adequately treated non melanoma skin\n             cancer, curatively treated in-situ cancer of the cervix, Ductal Carcinoma in Situ\n             (DCIS), stage  grade  endometrial carcinoma, or other solid tumours curatively\n             treated with no evidence of disease for ?  years prior to study entry.\n\n          . Mean resting corrected QTc interval using the Fridericia formula (QTcF) >\n             msec/female patients and > msec for male patients or congenital long QT syndrome.\n\n          . Any of the protocol specified cardiac diseases currently or within the last  months\n             defined by New York Heart Association (NYHA) ? Class :\n\n         . Concomitant use of known strong cytochrome P (CYP) A inhibitors or use of known\n             strong or moderate CYPA inducers.\n\n         . Persistent toxicities (? CTCAE grade ) caused by previous cancer therapy, excluding\n             alopecia and CTCAE grade  peripheral neuropathy.\n\n         . Major surgery within  weeks of starting study treatment: patients must have recovered\n             from any effects of any major surgery.\n\n         . Immunocompromised patients, eg,human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) patients.\n\n         . Patients with known active hepatitis (B or C).\n\n         . Patients considered a poor medical risk due to a serious, uncontrolled medical\n             disorder, non malignant systemic disease or active, uncontrolled infection.\n\n         . Patients with symptomatic uncontrolled brain metastases.\n\n         . Patients unable to swallow orally administered medication and patients with\n             gastrointestinal disorders likely to interfere with absorption of the study\n             medication.\n\n         . Patients with a known hypersensitivity to olaparib, AZD, AZD, or any of the\n             excipients of the products.\n\n         . Pregnant or breast feeding women.
Inclusion Criteria:\n\n        For inclusion in this study, patients must fulfil the following criteria:\n\n          -  Has read and understands the informed consent form (ICF) and has given written\n             informed consent prior to any study procedures.\n\n          -  Female or male aged ? years.\n\n          -  Has completed  of the parent AZD clinical pharmacology studies (ie, DC,\n             DC, DC, DC, or DC) and in the Investigator's\n             opinion will continue to benefit from treatment with AZD. Patients who discontinue\n             early from the parent study will be considered by the Sponsor and treating physician\n             on a case-by-case basis.\n\n          -  Any prior radiation must have been completed at least  days prior to the start of\n             study treatment, and patients must have recovered from any acute effects prior to the\n             start of study treatment.\n\n          -  Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) Performance Status score of  to .\n\n          -  Baseline laboratory values within  days of study treatment initiation in the CA\n             study:\n\n               -  Absolute neutrophil count (ANC) ?/?L.\n\n               -  Haemoglobin ? g/dL.\n\n               -  Platelets ?,/?L.\n\n               -  Alanine aminotransferase (ALT) and aspartate aminotransferase (AST) ? x upper\n                  limit of normal (ULN) or ? x ULN if known hepatic metastases.\n\n               -  Serum bilirubin within normal limits or ?. x ULN in patients with liver\n                  metastases; or total bilirubin ?. x ULN with direct bilirubin within normal\n                  limits in patients with well documented Gilbert's Syndrome.\n\n               -  Serum creatinine ?. x ULN, or measured creatinine clearance (CrCl) calculated\n                  by Cockcroft-Gault method ? mL/min (confirmation of creatinine clearance is\n                  only required when creatinine is >. x ULN) CrCl (glomerular filtration rate) =\n                  (-age) x (weight/kg) x Fa ( x serum creatinine mg/dL) where F = . for\n                  females and F =  for males.\n\n          -  Female patients who are of non-childbearing potential and fertile women of\n             childbearing potential (WoCBP) who agree to use adequate contraceptive measures that\n             are in place during screening (or consent), for the duration of the study, and for \n             month after treatment stops; who are not breastfeeding; and who have a negative serum\n             or urine pregnancy test prior to the start of study treatment.\n\n          -  Male patients must be willing to use barrier contraception (ie, condoms) for the\n             duration of the study and for  months after study treatment discontinuation.\n\n          -  Willingness and ability to comply with the study and the follow-up procedures.\n\n        Exclusion Criteria:\n\n        Patients must not enrol in this study if any of the following exclusion criteria are\n        fulfilled:\n\n          -  Involvement in the planning and/or conduct of the study (applies to both AstraZeneca\n             personnel and/or personnel at the study centre).\n\n          -  Previous enrolment and received study treatment in the present study. Patients can,\n             however, be re-screened if the reason for the screen failure no longer exists.\n\n          -  Concurrent enrolment in another clinical study, unless it is an observational\n             (non-interventional) clinical study or the follow-up period of an interventional\n             study.\n\n          -  Must not have received another systemic anti-cancer therapy in the interval following\n             participation in the AZD clinical pharmacology study and the start of treatment on\n             the CA protocol.\n\n          -  Not developed any clinical findings suggestive of brain metastasis. Patients continue\n             to be neurological stable and remain off systemic corticosteroids following treatment\n             of known brain metastases.\n\n          -  Did not tolerate AZD in the parent study in the opinion of the Investigator.\n\n          -  Where a course of palliative radiotherapy was indicated, the last fraction must have\n             been delivered before the start of study treatment on the CA study.\n\n          -  Major surgical procedures ? days of beginning study treatment, or minor surgical\n             procedures ? days. No waiting period required following port-a-cath placement or\n             other central venous access placement.\n\n          -  Grade > toxicities from prior therapy, according to the Common Terminology Criteria\n             for Adverse Events (CTCAE), excluding alopecia or anorexia.\n\n          -  Continue to be able to swallow oral medication, did not undergo placement of a\n             percutaneous endoscopic gastrostomy tube and did not require total parenteral\n             nutrition.\n\n          -  Has had prescription or non-prescription drugs or other products known to be sensitive\n             to CYPA substrates or CYPA substrates with a narrow therapeutic index, or to be\n             moderate to strong inhibitors/inducers of CYPA between the parent study and entry\n             into this CA study. Co administration of aprepitant or fosaprepitant during this study\n             is prohibited.\n\n          -  Has consumed herbal preparations between the parent study and entry into this CA\n             study.\n\n          -  Has consumed grapefruit, grapefruit juice, Seville oranges, Seville orange marmalade,\n             or other products containing grapefruit or Seville oranges between the parent study\n             and entry into the CA study.\n\n          -  Any known hypersensitivity or contraindication to AZD or to the components\n             thereof.\n\n          -  Any of the following cardiac diseases currently or within the last  months as defined\n             by the New York Heart Association ?Class :\n\n               -  Unstable angina pectoris.\n\n               -  Congestive heart failure.\n\n               -  Acute myocardial infarction.\n\n               -  Conduction abnormality not controlled with pacemaker or medication.\n\n               -  Significant ventricular or supraventricular arrhythmias (patients with chronic\n                  rate-controlled atrial fibrillation in the absence of other cardiac abnormalities\n                  are eligible).\n\n          -  AZD should not be given to patients who have a history of Torsades de pointes\n             unless all risk factors that contributed to Torsades have been corrected. AZD has\n             not been studied in patients with ventricular arrhythmias or recent myocardial\n             infarction.\n\n          -  Patient with mean resting QTc interval (specifically QTc calculated using the\n             Fridericia formula [QTcF]) > ms for males and > ms for females from \n             electrocardiograms (ECGs) performed within  to  minutes apart during screening, or\n             congenital long QT syndrome.\n\n          -  Pregnant or lactating female patients.\n\n          -  Serious, symptomatic active infection at the time of study entry, or another serious\n             underlying medical condition that would impair the ability of the patient to receive\n             study treatment.\n\n          -  Active infection with hepatitis B, hepatitis C, or human immunodeficiency virus (HIV).
Inclusion Criteria\n\n        Subjects must fulfil all of the following requirements:\n\n          . A histologically or cytologically confirmed cancer that is metastatic and is approved\n             to be treated with Nivolumab or Atezolizumab with the following origins: melanoma,\n             NSCLC, HNSCC, RCC, and urothelial cancer, as well as the following:\n\n               . Subjects must not be considered eligible for a potentially curative resection.\n\n               . Subjects who are eligible for PD-/PD-L therapy or who have exhausted all\n                  standard therapies for their disease except for immunotherapy.\n\n                  either c) or d)\n\n               . Subjects progressed on their prior treatment before initiating treatment on\n                  current study.\n\n                  Or\n\n               . Subjects, who are currently being treated with PD- or PD-L inhibitors Nivolumab\n                  or Atezolizumab and have achieved at least stable disease (SD), and who, in the\n                  judgment of their treating physicians, could benefit from the addition of\n                  DSP- vaccine to improve or maintain their response.\n\n             In expansion part only: All subjects who are candidates for immunotherapy including\n             PD-/PD-L inhibitors are eligible to enroll in the study. Subjects must have at least\n              target lesion based on RECIST criteria and other supporting disease specific\n             evaluation criteria.\n\n          . Subjects must be positive for at least  of the following human leukocyte antigens\n             (HLA):\n\n               . HLA-A*:\n\n               . HLA-A*:\n\n               . HLA-A*:\n\n          . ?  years of age.\n\n          . Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status of  or .\n\n          . Either archival tumor tissue must be available or subject must consent to undergo a\n             tumor biopsy before administration of first dose.\n\n          . Females of childbearing potential must have a negative serum pregnancy test.\n\n          . Male or female subjects of child-producing potential must agree to use contraception\n             or use prevention of pregnancy measures (true abstinence) during the study and for \n             days after the last dose.\n\n          . Total bilirubin of ? . mg/dL (? . mg/dL for subjects with known Gilbert's\n             syndrome)\n\n          . Aspartate aminotransferase (AST) ? .  the upper limit of normal (ULN) or <   ULN\n             if considered to be due to liver metastases.\n\n         . Alanine transaminase (ALT) ? .  the upper limit of normal (ULN) or <   ULN if\n             considered to be due to liver metastases.\n\n         . Glomerular Filtration Rate >  mL/min.\n\n         . Multigated acquisition (MUGA) scan or echocardiogram with left ventricular ejection\n             fraction (LVEF) > %.\n\n         . Life expectancy ?  months.\n\n         . Subjects must be willing to provide a personally signed and dated informed consent\n             document.\n\n        Exclusion Criteria\n\n        Subjects with any of the following will be excluded from the study:\n\n          . Anticancer chemotherapy (including molecular targeted drugs), immunotherapy, or\n             investigational agents within  days of the first dose of DSP-; radiotherapy\n             within  weeks of the first dose of DSP-. Subjects may begin DSP- on a date\n             determined by the Investigator and medical monitor for the Sponsor provided that all\n             treatment related adverse events (AEs) have resolved or have been deemed irreversible.\n             This exclusion is not applied to subjects who meet the inclusion criterion d.\n\n          . In expansion part only: Subjects progressed on their prior checkpoint inhibitors\n             (PD-/PD-L) treatment before initiating treatment on current study.\n\n          . Major surgery within  weeks prior to study treatment.\n\n          . Subject has received a live vaccine within  days prior to the first dose.\n\n          . Any known, untreated brain metastases. Subjects with treated brain metastases must be\n             clinically stable for  weeks after completion of treatment for brain metastases and\n             have radiographic image documentation of stability. Subjects must have no clinical\n             symptoms from brain metastases and not have required systemic corticosteroids > \n             mg/day prednisone or equivalent for at least  weeks prior to the first dose of study\n             drug.\n\n          . Subject has multifocal glioblastoma.\n\n          . Pregnant or breastfeeding.\n\n          . Subject has an active autoimmune disease requiring immunosuppression with the\n             exception of subjects with isolated vitiligo, resolved childhood asthma or atopic\n             dermatitis, controlled hypoadrenalism or hypopituitarism, and euthyroid subjects with\n             a history of Grave's disease.\n\n             a. Subjects with controlled hyperthyroidism must be negative for thyroglobulin and\n             thyroid peroxidase antibodies and thyroid stimulating immunoglobulin prior to study\n             drug administration.\n\n          . Subject has interstitial lung disease or active, non-infectious pneumonitis.\n\n         . Known hypersensitivity to a component of protocol therapy.\n\n               . Subjects with known hypersensitivity to any of the components of DSP- Dosing\n                  Emulsion.\n\n               . Subjects with known hypersensitivity to Nivolumab or Atezolizumab are excluded\n                  from receiving combination therapy that includes the agent to which they are\n                  hypersensitive.\n\n         . Uncontrolled concurrent illness including, but not limited to, ongoing or active\n             infection, clinically significant non-healing or healing wounds, symptomatic\n             congestive heart failure, unstable angina pectoris, severe and/or uncontrolled cardiac\n             arrhythmia, significant pulmonary disease, uncontrolled infection or psychiatric\n             illness/social situations that would limit compliance with study requirements.\n\n         . Subjects with a history of another primary cancer with the exception of: a) curatively\n             resected non-melanoma skin cancer; b) curatively treated cervical carcinoma in situ;\n             c) localized prostate cancer not requiring systemic therapy; and d) any another cancer\n             from which the subject has been disease free for ?  years that, in the opinion of the\n             Investigator and medical monitor for the Sponsor, will not affect subject outcome in\n             the setting of the current diagnosis.\n\n         . Patient has a QTcF (QT corrected based on Fridericia's equation) interval >  msec\n             (CTCAE = Grade ) or other factors that increase the risk of QT prolongation or\n             arrhythmic events (e.g., heart failure, hypokalemia, family history of long QT\n             interval syndrome) at screening. (Patients with bundle branch block and a prolonged\n             QTc interval should be reviewed by the Medical Monitor for potential inclusion.)\n\n         . Subject has a medical history of frequent or sustained ventricular ectopy.\n\n         . Subject has, in the opinion of the treating Investigator, any concurrent conditions\n             that could pose an undue medical hazard or interfere with the interpretation of the\n             study results.\n\n         . Known history of human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infection, active hepatitis B, or\n             untreated hepatitis C; patients who have completed a course of anti-viral treatment\n             for hepatitis C are eligible.\n\n         . Subject has baseline signs and symptoms consistent with clinically significant,\n             decreased pulmonary function: () blood saturation oxygen level (SpO) < % at rest\n             on room air; () dyspnea at rest or required supplemental oxygen within  weeks of\n             study enrollment.
Inclusion Criteria:\n\n          -  Patient has histologically or cytologically proven advanced (unresectable) or\n             metastatic cancer as outlined below according to study part and disease type:\n\n          -  Part A: Patients with previously treated advanced or metastatic cancer. Patient may\n             have received no more than  lines of treatment for advanced or metastatic cancer.\n             Hormonal treatment will not be considered a prior line of treatment.\n\n          -  Part B: Patients with advanced or metastatic cancer for which treatment with\n             carboplatin-paclitaxel is considered appropriate therapy. Patient may have received no\n             more than  prior line of chemotherapy in the metastatic setting. Hormonal treatment\n             will not be considered a prior line of treatment.\n\n          -  Part C: Patients with previously treated advanced or metastatic cancer. Patient may\n             have received no more than  lines of treatment for advanced or metastatic cancer.\n             Hormonal treatment will not be considered a prior line of treatment.\n\n          -  Part D: Patients in whom carboplatin-paclitaxel and bevacizumab is considered\n             appropriate therapy. Patient may have received no more than  prior line of\n             chemotherapy in the metastatic setting. Hormonal treatment will not be considered a\n             prior line of treatment.\n\n          -  Patient has an Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status of  to .\n\n          -  Patient has adequate organ function\n\n          -  Female patient has a negative serum pregnancy test within  hours prior to taking\n             study treatment if of childbearing potential and agrees to abstain from activities\n             that could result in pregnancy from screening through  days after the last dose of\n             study treatment, or is of non-childbearing potential.\n\n          -  Male patient agrees to use an adequate method of contraception and not donate sperm\n             starting with the first dose of study treatment through  days after the last dose of\n             study treatment. Note: Abstinence is acceptable if this is the established and\n             preferred contraception for the patient.\n\n          -  Patient has measurable lesions by RECIST v..\n\n        For Part A and C, in addition to the general inclusion criteria, patients must also meet\n        the following additional criterion to be considered eligible to participate in this study:\n\n          -  Patient is able to take oral medications.\n\n          -  For patients to be eligible for any parts of the study using niraparib  mg as a\n             starting dose, a screening actual body weight ?  kg and screening platelet count ?\n             , u/L is necessary.\n\n        Exclusion Criteria:\n\n        (Patients will not be eligible for the study entry if any of the following criteria are\n        met)\n\n          -  Patient has known active central nervous system metastases, carcinomatous meningitis,\n             or both.\n\n          -  Patient has a known additional malignancy that progressed or required active treatment\n             within the last  years. Exceptions include basal cell carcinoma of the skin, squamous\n             cell carcinoma of the skin that has undergone potentially curative therapy, or in situ\n             cervical cancer.\n\n          -  Patient is considered a poor medical risk due to a serious, uncontrolled medical\n             disorder, nonmalignant systemic disease, or active infection that requires systemic\n             therapy.\n\n          -  Patient has a condition (such as transfusion-dependent anemia or thrombocytopenia),\n             therapy, or laboratory abnormality that might confound the study results or interfere\n             with the patient's participation\n\n          -  Patient is pregnant or expecting to conceive children within the projected duration of\n             the study, starting with the screening visit through  days after the last dose of\n             study treatment.\n\n        Note: No data are available regarding the presence of niraparib or its metabolites in human\n        milk, or on its effects on the breastfed infant or milk production. Because of the\n        potential for serious adverse reactions in breastfed infants from niraparib, female\n        patients should not breastfeed during treatment with niraparib and for  month after\n        receiving the final dose.\n\n          -  Patient has a known history of human immunodeficiency virus (type  or  antibodies).\n\n          -  Patient has known active hepatitis B or hepatitis C.\n\n          -  Patient has an active autoimmune disease that has required systemic treatment in the\n             past  years.\n\n          -  Patient has received prior therapy with an anti-PD-, anti-PD-L, anti-PD-L,\n             anti-CTLA- including ipilimumab), or any other antibody or drug specifically\n             targeting T-cell co-stimulation or checkpoint pathways.\n\n          -  Patient has undergone prior treatment with a known PARP inhibitor.\n\n          -  Known history or current diagnosis of MDS or AML.\n\n        For Parts C and D only, patients will not be eligible for study entry if the following\n        additional exclusion criterion is met:\n\n          -  Patient has clinically significant cardiovascular disease (e.g., significant cardiac\n             conduction abnormalities, uncontrolled hypertension, myocardial infarction, cardiac\n             arrhythmia or unstable angina, New York Heart Association Grade  or greater\n             congestive heart failure, serious cardiac arrhythmia requiring medication, Grade  or\n             greater peripheral vascular disease, and history of cerebrovascular accident [CVA])\n             within  months of enrollment.\n\n          -  Patient has a history of bowel obstruction, including subocclusive disease, related to\n             the underlying disease and history of abdominal fistula, gastrointestinal perforation,\n             or intra abdominal abscesses. Evidence of recto-sigmoid involvement by pelvic\n             examination or bowel involvement on CT scan or clinical symptoms of bowel obstruction.\n\n          -  Patient has proteinuria as demonstrated by urine protein: creatinine ratio ?. at\n             screening or urine dipstick for proteinuria ? (patients discovered to have ?\n             proteinuria on dipstick at baseline should undergo -hour urine collection and must\n             demonstrate < g of protein in  hours to be eligible).\n\n          -  Patient is at increased bleeding risk due to concurrent conditions (e.g., major\n             injuries or surgery within the past  days prior to start of study treatment, history\n             of hemorrhagic stroke, transient ischemic attack, subarachnoid hemorrhage, or\n             clinically significant hemorrhage within the past  months).\n\n          -  Patient has a known hypersensitivity to bevacizumab components or excipients

 at time of informed consent\n\n          -  Biopsy-proven DLBCL excluding DLBCL that represents transformation of indolent NHL\n             Note: Lymphoblastic Lymphoma and Burkitt Lymphoma histology are not eligible\n\n          -  Subject has ?  weeks prior to enrollment\n\n          -  Known infection with human immunodeficiency virus or chronic infection with hepatitis\n             B virus (hepatitis B surface antigen positive) or hepatitis C virus (anti-hepatitis C\n             virus positive)\n\n          -  History of malignancy other than DLBCL within the past  years with the following\n             exceptions:\n\n             o Malignancy treated with curative intent and with no known active disease present for\n             ?  years before enrollment and felt to be at low risk for recurrence by the treating\n             physician\n\n             o Adequately treated non-melanoma skin cancer or lentigo maligna without evidence of\n             disease\n\n             o Adequately treated cervical carcinoma in situ without evidence of disease\n\n               -  Adequately treated breast ductal carcinoma in situ without evidence of disease\n\n               -  Prostatic intraepithelial neoplasia without evidence of prostate cancer\n\n               -  Adequately treated urothelial papillary noninvasive carcinoma or carcinoma in\n                  situ\n\n          -  Subject has known hypersensitivity to immunoglobulins or any of the products or\n             components to be administered during dosing.\n\n          -  History or evidence of any other clinically significant disorder, condition or disease\n             (with the exception of those outlined above) that, in the opinion of the investigator\n             or Amgen physician, if consulted, would pose a risk to subject safety or interfere\n             with the study evaluation, procedures or completion.\n\n          -  Women who are pregnant or breastfeeding or planning to become pregnant or breastfeed\n             while receiving blinatumomab and for an additional  hours after the last treatment\n             dose of blinatumomab. (Females of child bearing potential should only be included\n             after a negative highly sensitive urine or serum pregnancy test.)\n\n          -  Women of childbearing potential unwilling to use an acceptable method of effective\n             contraception while receiving blinatumomab and for an additional  hours after last\n             dose of blinatumomab. Note: The pregnancy, breastfeeding and contraceptive\n             requirements are specific to blinatumomab. The investigator is responsible for\n             providing the subject (male and female) with pregnancy and breastfeeding (female only)\n             avoidance requirements for other medications given during the study.\n\n          -  Currently receiving treatment in another investigational device or drug study or less\n             than  days since ending treatment on another investigational device or drug study.\n             Other investigational procedures while participating in this study are excluded.\n\n        Inclusion and Exclusion Criteria - Part  Inclusion Criteria - Part \n\n          -  MRD-positive assessment (by NGS analysis) at enrollment or at any time during the\n             run-in  period\n\n          -  PET-CT negative (defined by Deauville criteria ? ) at run-in  performed ?  weeks\n             from MRD-positive assessment at run-in . Historical PET-CT are allowed if performed ?\n              weeks from day  (first dose of blinatumomab) and subject has no clinical signs or\n             symptoms suggestive of disease progression (eg, increase in lactate dehydrogenase\n             [LDH] not otherwise explained)\n\n          -  Adequate organ function determined ?  week prior to treatment assignment with\n             blinatumomab as follows:\n\n               -  Hematological:\n\n        ANC ? . x /L Hemoglobin ?  g/L Platelet count ?  x /L o Renal: Creatinine\n        clearance ?  mL/min Cockcroft-Gault equation\n\n        o Hepatic: AST and ALT <  x ULN Total bilirubin <  x ULN (unless Gilbert's Disease or if\n        liver involvement with lymphoma)\n\n        Exclusion Criteria - Part  Subject has active infection requiring systemic therapy Any\n        change in the part  eligibility criteria during the run-in period.\n\n        Other Exclusion Criteria may apply
Inclusion Criteria:-\n\n          -  Participants with histologically confirmed advanced ovarian cancer or triple negative\n             breast cancer who in the opinion of the Investigator are appropriate for this study\n\n          -  Measurable disease by RECIST criteria version . prior to study drug administration\n\n          -  Performance status of  or  on the eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) scale\n\n          -  Life expectancy, in the opinion of the Investigator, of at least  months\n\n          -  Disease-free of active second/secondary or prior malignancies for =>  years with the\n             exception of squamous cell carcinoma of the skin, or carcinoma in situ of the cervix\n             or breast\n\n          -  Willing to provide the protocol specified tumor biopsies\n\n          -  Acceptable hematologic status, liver and renal function\n\n          -  Participants who have received prior treatment with CD agonists or immune\n             checkpoint blockade therapies, including anti-CTLA-, anti-PD-, and anti-PD-L\n             therapeutic antibodies, may be enrolled, provided the following requirements are met:\n\n               -  Minimum of  months from the last dose of anti-PD-, anti-CTLA-, anti-PD- L or\n                  CD agonist treatment\n\n               -  No history of severe immune-related adverse effects from CD agonist,\n                  anti?CTLA-, anti-PD- or anti-PD-L (NCI CTCAE Grade  and ). Any toxicity\n                  related to the therapy must have resolved completely, no residual toxicity as\n                  assessed by NCI CTCAE (v.)\n\n          -  Agree to use protocol defined methods of contraception\n\n        Exclusion Criteria:\n\n          -  Participants with history of prior malignancy except solid tumor treated curatively\n             more than  years ago without evidence of recurrence\n\n          -  Asymptomatic or symptomatic, untreated, or actively progressing central nervous system\n             (CNS) metastases\n\n          -  History of leptomeningeal disease\n\n          -  Uncontrolled tumor-related pain\n\n          -  Uncontrolled pleural effusion, pericardial effusion, or ascites requiring recurrent\n             drainage procedures. Participants with indwelling catheters are allowed.\n\n          -  Uncontrolled or symptomatic hypercalcemia\n\n          -  New York Heart Association Class III or IV cardiac disease, pericarditis, myocardial\n             infarction within the past  months, unstable arrhythmia\n\n          -  Fredericia-corrected QT interval (QTcF) >  milli seconds (msec) (female) or > \n             msec (male), or history of congenital long QT syndrome. Any electrocardiogram (ECG)\n             abnormality, including pericarditis, which in the opinion of the Investigator would\n             preclude safe participation in the study.\n\n          -  Active, uncontrolled bacterial, viral, or fungal infections within  days of study\n             entry requiring systemic therapy\n\n          -  Known clinically important respiratory impairment\n\n          -  History of major organ transplant\n\n          -  History of an autologous or allogeneic bone marrow transplant\n\n          -  Serious non-malignant disease that could compromise protocol objectives in the opinion\n             of the Investigator and/or the Sponsor\n\n          -  Pregnant or nursing women\n\n          -  Any systemic anticancer therapy within  weeks prior to Cycle  Day \n\n          -  Any radiation treatment to metastatic site within <=  days of Cycle  Day \n\n          -  Major surgical procedure, open biopsy, or significant traumatic injury within  days\n             prior to Cycle  Day  or anticipation of need for major surgical procedure during the\n             course of the study\n\n          -  History of severe allergic, anaphylactic, or other hypersensitivity reactions to\n             chimeric or humanized antibodies or fusion proteins\n\n          -  Known hypersensitivity or allergy to biopharmaceuticals produced in Chinese hamster\n             ovary cells or any component of the atezolizumab formulation\n\n          -  Active or history of autoimmune disease\n\n          -  History of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (including pneumonitis), drug-induced\n             pneumonitis, organizing pneumonia (i.e., bronchiolitis obliterans, cryptogenic\n             organizing pneumonia), or evidence of active pneumonitis on screening chest computed\n             tomography (CT) scan. History of radiation pneumonitis in the radiation field\n             (fibrosis) is permitted\n\n          -  Positive test for Human immunodeficiency virus (HIV)\n\n          -  Active hepatitis B or hepatitis C\n\n          -  Receipt of a live, attenuated vaccine within  weeks prior to randomization or\n             anticipation that such a live, attenuated vaccine will be required during the study\n\n          -  Treatment with investigational therapy within  days prior to initiation of study\n             treatment\n\n          -  Treatment with therapeutic oral or IV antibiotics within  weeks prior to initiation\n             of study treatment\n\n          -  Consumption of agents which strongly inhibit CYPA enzyme, within  days prior to the\n             first dose of study treatment and during the study\n\n          -  Consumption of agents which strongly induce CYPA enzyme, within  days prior to the\n             first dose of study treatment and during the study\n\n          -  Treatment with systemic immuno-stimulatory agents within  weeks or five half-lives of\n             the drug (whichever is shorter) prior to the first dose of study treatment\n\n          -  Treatment with systemic corticosteroids or other systemic immunosuppressive\n             medications within  weeks prior to the first dose of study treatment, or, anticipated\n             requirement for systemic immunosuppressive medications during the trial\n\n          -  History of allergic reactions attributed to components of the formulated product(s)\n\n          -  Unwillingness or inability to comply with procedures required in this protocol

Have measurable disease per RECIST Version . (expansion phase only)\n\n          . Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status of  or \n\n          . Expected survival of more than  weeks;\n\n          . For female patients of childbearing potential and male patients with partners of\n             childbearing potential, agreement (by patient and partner) to use a highly effective\n             form(s) of contraception that results in a low failure rate ( < % per year) when used\n             consistently and correctly, and to continue its use for  days after the last dose of\n             fruquintinib.\n\n        Exclusion Criteria:\n\n        Patients will be excluded from the study, if any of the following criteria is met:\n\n          . Absolute neutrophil count (ANC) < ./L, platelet count <  /L, or\n             hemoglobin <  g/L;\n\n          . Serum total bilirubin > . times the upper limit of normal (ULN);\n\n          . Alanine aminotransferase (ALT) aspartate aminotransferase (AST) > . ULN in patients\n             without hepatic metastases or ALT, AST >  ULN in patients with hepatic metastases;\n\n          . Serum potassium, calcium, or magnesium levels out of the normal laboratory reference\n             range, and clinically significant in the investigator's judgment.\n\n          . Serum creatinine clearance <  mL/min;\n\n          . Urine dipstick for proteinuria >  +. Patients discovered to have ?  + proteinuria on\n             dipstick urinalysis at baseline should undergo a -hour urine collection and must\n             demonstrate ?  g of protein in  hours;\n\n          . Uncontrolled hypertension, defined as: systolic blood pressure ?  mmHg and/or\n             diastolic blood pressure ? mmHg;\n\n          . International Normalized Ratio (INR) >  or activated partial thromboplastin time\n             (aPTT) > . ULN, except if the patient is currently receiving or intending to receive\n             anti-coagulants for therapeutic purposes (prophylactic use is allowed).\n\n          . Risk of, or active hemorrhage: history or presence of active gastric/duodenal ulcer or\n             ulcerative colitis, active hemorrhage of an unresected gastrointestinal tumor, or any\n             other condition that could possibly result in gastrointestinal tract hemorrhage or\n             perforation;\n\n         . History or presence of hemorrhage from any other site (e.g., hemoptysis or\n             hematemesis) within  months prior to screening\n\n         . History of a thromboembolic event (including DVT, pulmonary embolism, stroke and/or\n             transient ischemic attack) within  months prior to screening;\n\n         . Patients with squamous non-small-cell lung cancer (NSCLC);\n\n         . Clinically significant cardiovascular disease, including but not limited to acute\n             myocardial infarction or coronary artery bypass surgery within  months prior to\n             enrollment, severe or unstable angina pectoris, New York Heart Association Class\n             III/IV congestive heart failure, ventricular arrhythmias requiring treatment, or left\n             ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) < %;\n\n         . Mean corrected QT interval using the Fredericia method (QTcF) >  msec or any\n             factors that increase the risk of QTc prolongation or risk of arrhythmic events such\n             as hypokalemia, congenital long QT syndrome, family history of long QT syndrome, or\n             unexplained sudden death under  years of age in a next of kin relative.\n\n         . Concomitant medications with a known risk of causing QT prolongation and/or Torsades\n             de Pointes (See list in Appendix E; source list is continuously updated online at\n             www.qtdrugs.org ).\n\n         . Systemic anti-neoplastic therapies within  weeks prior to the initiation of\n             investigational treatment, including chemotherapy, radical radiotherapy,\n             hormonotherapy, bio-therapy and immunotherapy;\n\n         . Palliative radiotherapy for bone metastasis/lesion within  weeks prior to the\n             initiation of study treatment;\n\n         . Use of strong inducers or inhibitors of CYPA within  weeks before the first dose of\n             study treatment ( weeks for St John's Wort). See Appendix F for a list of such\n             medications.\n\n         . Surgery prior to enrollment within  days prior to the initiation of study treatment\n             or unhealed surgical incision;\n\n         . Toxicity from a previous anti-tumor treatment that does not return to Grade  or \n             (except for alopecia);\n\n         . Known human immunodeficiency virus (HIV), hepatitis A, B or C infection except for\n             fully recovered Hepatitis A. Previous medical history of hepatitis B virus (HBV)\n             infection regardless of drug control, HBV DNA ? copy number or ? IU/mL;\n\n         . Known clinically significant history of liver disease, including hepatitis or\n             cirrhosis; current alcohol abuse.,\n\n         . Evidence of ongoing or active infection requiring intravenous antibiotics;\n\n         . Women who are pregnant or lactating;\n\n         . Central nervous system (CNS) metastatic disease or prior cerebral metastasis;\n\n         . Inability to take medication orally, dysphagia or an active gastric ulcer resulting\n             from previous surgery (e.g., gastric bypass) or a severe gastrointestinal disease, or\n             any other condition that investigators believe may affect absorption of the\n             investigational product;\n\n         . Received investigational treatment in another clinical study within  weeks prior to\n             the initiation of investigational treatment;\n\n         . Other disease, metabolic disorder, physical examination anomaly, abnormal laboratory\n             result, or any other condition that investigators suspect may prohibit use of the\n             investigational product, affect interpretation of study results, or put the patient at\n             undue risk of harm.
