Inclusion Criteria\n\n          -  Histologically and/or cytologically confirmed primary diagnosis of Stage IV NSCLC\n             (according to American Joint Committee on Cancer [AJCC] th edition lung cancer\n             staging criteria).\n\n          -  Measurable disease according to RECIST v...\n\n          -  An EGFR exon  deletion and/or an exon  (LR) substitution mutation.\n\n          -  BDX Positive Label.\n\n          -  Have received no prior systemic chemotherapy, immunotherapy, targeted therapy, or\n             biologic therapy for metastatic NSCLC. Subjects may have previously been treated with\n             postoperative adjuvant chemotherapy for early stage lung cancer or chemo radiotherapy\n             for locally advanced disease provided this was completed at least  months prior to\n             enrollment. No prior EGFR TKI therapy is allowed for any stage of NSCLC.\n\n          -  Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status of  or . Exclusion\n             Criteria\n\n          -  History of severe allergic or anaphylactic reactions or hypersensitivity to\n             recombinant proteins or excipients in the investigational agent or erlotinib.\n\n          -  History of known brain metastases.\n\n          -  Prior treatment with any other investigational drug or biologic agent within  half\n             lives prior to randomization, or any investigational device within  weeks prior to\n             randomization.\n\n          -  Any unresolved toxicity from previous radiation therapy.\n\n          -  Significant cardiovascular disease, including:\n\n               -  Echocardiogram (ECHO) or multiple gated acquisition (MUGA) showing left\n                  ventricular ejection fraction of less than %.\n\n               -  Cardiac failure New York Heart Association class III or IV.\n\n               -  Myocardial infarction, severe or unstable angina within  months prior to\n                  randomization.\n\n               -  History of serious ventricular arrhythmia (ie, ventricular tachycardia or\n                  ventricular fibrillation).\n\n               -  Significant thrombotic or embolic events within  months prior to randomization\n                  (significant thrombotic or embolic events include but are not limited to stroke\n                  or transient ischemic attack).\n\n               -  Any uncontrolled or severe cardiovascular disease.\n\n          -  History of prior malignancy within  years prior to randomization (except for\n             adequately treated non-melanoma skin cancer, carcinoma in situ of the breast or\n             cervix, superficial bladder cancer, or early stage prostate cancer, without evidence\n             of recurrence).\n\n          -  Radiographic evidence of interstitial lung disease.
Inclusion Criteria:\n\n          . Male or female patients, >  years of age (in Singapore >  years or >  years with\n             consent of guardian).\n\n          . Patients with documented (histologically- or cytologically-proven) HCC, with at least\n              measureable lesion >  mm (excluding bone metastases). If the measurable lesion(s)\n             is in the liver, it either should not have been treated previously with loco-regional\n             therapy, or there must be demonstrated progression of the lesion following previous\n             loco-regional therapy.\n\n          . Patients with Barcelona Clinic Liver Cancer (BCLC) stage B or C HCC not amenable to\n             surgical intervention due to either medical contraindications or non-resectability of\n             the tumor.\n\n          . Patients who are either refractory to or intolerant of sorafenib despite dose\n             reduction and best supportive care, or patients who do not have access to sorafenib or\n             other suitable therapy for HCC.\n\n          . Patients with underlying hepatic cirrhosis must have a current cirrhosis status of\n             Child-Pugh Class A (i.e., score of -) without encephalopathy.\n\n          . Phase b MTD Biopsy Cohort: Patients with primary or metastatic tumor site(s)\n             considered safely accessible for biopsy and consenting to undergo pre- and post-dosing\n             tumor biopsies.\n\n          . Patients with an Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status of  or\n             , and an anticipated life expectancy of ?  months.\n\n          . Patients, both male and female, who are either not of childbearing potential or who\n             agree to use a medically effective method of contraception during the study and for \n             months after the last dose of study drug.\n\n          . Patients with the ability to understand and give written informed consent for\n             participation in this trial, including all evaluations and procedures as specified by\n             this protocol.\n\n        Exclusion Criteria (Patients):\n\n          . Women who are pregnant or lactating; women of child-bearing potential (WOCBP), and\n             fertile men with a WOCBP-partner not using and not willing to use a medically\n             effective method of contraception.\n\n          . Patients with known central nervous system (CNS) or leptomeningeal metastases not\n             controlled by prior surgery or radiotherapy, or patients with symptoms suggesting CNS\n             involvement for which treatment is required.\n\n          . Patients with mixed histology cholangiocarcinoma and HCC, or fibrolamellar variant\n             HCC.\n\n          . Patients with any of the following hematologic abnormalities at baseline:\n\n               -  Hemoglobin < . g/dL\n\n               -  Absolute neutrophil count < , per mm\n\n               -  Platelet count < , per mm\n\n          . Patients with any of the following serum chemistry abnormalities at baseline:\n\n               -  Total bilirubin > .  the upper limit of normal (ULN) for the institution\n\n               -  AST or ALT >   the ULN for the institution\n\n               -  Serum creatinine > .  the ULN for the institution\n\n          . Patients with the following coagulation parameter abnormality at baseline:\n\n               -  INR > .  ULN for the institution\n\n          . Patients with:\n\n               -  A history of deep vein thrombosis (DVT) or pulmonary embolism (PE), within \n                  months prior to first study drug administration; patients receiving systemic\n                  anti-coagulation for prophylactic or therapeutic reasons\n\n               -  Active uncontrolled bleeding or a known bleeding diathesis\n\n          . Patients with:\n\n               -  Esophageal or gastric variceal bleeding within  months prior to first study drug\n                  administration; patients with a history of variceal bleeding between  and \n                  months prior to first study drug administration should have undergone adequate\n                  treatment and be considered clinically stable in the opinion of the investigator\n\n               -  A history of symptomatic ascites requiring paracentesis within the past  months\n                  or any encephalopathy requiring hospitalization or medication within the past \n                  months\n\n               -  Portal-caval shunts\n\n          . Patients with a significant cardiovascular disease or condition, including:\n\n               -  Congestive heart failure currently requiring therapy\n\n               -  Need for antiarrhythmic medical therapy for a ventricular arrhythmia\n\n               -  Severe conduction disturbance (i.e., rd degree heart block)\n\n               -  Angina pectoris requiring therapy\n\n               -  Known left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) < % by MUGA or echocardiogram\n\n               -  QTc interval >  msec in males, or >  msec in females\n\n               -  Uncontrolled systemic hypertension (per the Investigator's discretion)\n\n               -  Class III or IV cardiovascular disease according to the New York Heart\n                  Association (NYHA) Functional Criteria\n\n               -  Myocardial infarction within  months prior to first study drug administration\n\n         . Patients with a known or suspected hypersensitivity to any of the components of lipid\n             nanoparticle-formulated DCR-MYC; patients with a known sensitivity to cremophor (found\n             with paclitaxel and other formulations).\n\n         . Patients with an estimated daily alcohol intake greater than  g/day.\n\n         . Patients having undergone previous organ transplantation (e.g., liver transplantation)\n             requiring immunosuppression; patients on long-term immunosuppressive therapy.\n\n         . Patients with a known history of human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) seropositivity.\n\n         . Patients with any other serious/active/uncontrolled infection, with the exception of\n             chronic hepatitis B virus (HBV) or chronic hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection; any\n             infection requiring parenteral antibiotics, or unexplained fever > C within  weeks\n             prior to first study drug administration.\n\n         . Patients with inadequate recovery from an acute toxicity associated with any prior\n             antineoplastic therapy.\n\n         . Patients with inadequate recovery from any previous surgical procedure, or patients\n             having undergone any major surgical procedure within  weeks prior to first study drug\n             administration.\n\n         . Patients with an active second malignancy or history of another malignancy within the\n             last  years, with the exception of:\n\n               -  Treated, non-melanoma skin cancers\n\n               -  Treated CIS of the breast or cervix\n\n               -  Controlled, superficial carcinoma of the bladder\n\n               -  Ta or b carcinoma of the prostate treated according to local standard of care,\n                  with prostate specific antigen (PSA) within normal limits (wnl)\n\n         . Patients with any other life-threatening illness, significant organ system\n             dysfunction, or clinically significant laboratory abnormality, which, in the opinion\n             of the Investigator, would either compromise the patient's safety or interfere with\n             evaluation of the safety of the study drug.\n\n         . Patients with a psychiatric disorder or altered mental status that would preclude\n             understanding of the informed consent process and/or completion of the necessary\n             study-related evaluations.\n\n         . Patients with the inability or with foreseeable incapacity, in the opinion of the\n             Investigator, to comply with the protocol requirements, including the ability to\n             attend all visits and undergo all assessments.\n\n        Exclusion Criteria (Treatments):\n\n          . Phase b: Greater than  prior systemic anti-cancer chemotherapies or targeted agents\n             for HCC; prior loco-regional treatment, including transcatheter arterial\n             chemo-embolization (TACE), is allowed.\n\n          . Phase : greater than  prior systemic anti-cancer chemotherapy or targeted agent for\n             HCC; prior loco-regional treatment, including TACE, is allowed.\n\n          . Sorafenib therapy within  weeks prior to first study drug administration and during\n             study.\n\n          . Any other antineoplastic agent (standard or experimental) within  weeks; monoclonal\n             antibody therapy, nitrosoureas, and nitrogen mustard within  weeks prior to first\n             study drug administration and during study.\n\n          . Loco-regional therapy including TACE or radioembolization within  weeks prior to\n             first study drug administration and during study.\n\n          . Radiotherapy within  weeks prior to first study drug administration and during study.\n\n          . Therapy with sofosbuvir for HCV within  weeks prior to first study drug\n             administration and during study.\n\n          . Herbal preparations, or related non-prescription preparations/supplements containing\n             herbal ingredients, aimed at treating the underlying malignancy within  weeks prior\n             to first study drug administration and during study.\n\n          . Systemic hormonal therapy within  weeks prior to first study drug administration and\n             during study.\n\n         . Any other investigational treatments during study. This includes participation in any\n             medical device or therapeutic intervention clinical trial.\n\n         . Prophylactic use of hematopoietic growth factors within  week prior to first study\n             drug administration and during Cycle  of study; thereafter prophylactic use of growth\n             factors is allowed as clinically indicated.
Inclusion Criteria -\n\n          . Between the ages of greater or equal to (?)  months and less than (<)  years of age\n\n          . Must have histologically proven B-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL) or B-cell\n             lymphoblastic lymphoma with marrow involvement\n\n          . All participants (both ALL and participants with lymphoblastic lymphoma) must have M\n             or M bone marrow classification\n\n          . Disease status: a) Participants must have relapsed or refractory disease b) In the\n             event of relapse after prior allogeneic hematopoietic stem cell transplant (HSCT),\n             participants must be at least  months post-transplant and have no evidence of active\n             graft-vs-host disease, and must have been off immunosuppression for at least  weeks,\n             c) Must have resolution of the acute toxic effects to less than or equal to (?) Grade\n              from prior chemotherapy before entry, in the opinion of the investigator\n\n          . Participants with the following central nervous system (CNS)  or  status are\n             eligible only in the absence of neurologic symptoms\n\n          . Female participants of childbearing potential and post-pubertal male participants must\n             use an approved method of contraception for the study.\n\n        Exclusion Criteria\n\n          . Concurrent enrollment in another clinical study for cancer treatment, unless the\n             subject is in the follow-up period from a previous study.\n\n          . Isolated testicular or CNS ALL\n\n          . Participants with mixed-lineage leukemia (MLL) gene rearrangement\n\n          . Inadequate Hepatic function\n\n          . Inadequate Renal function\n\n          . Radiologically-detected CNS lymphoma\n\n          . Participants with clear laboratory or clinical evidence of disseminated intravascular\n             coagulation (DIC)\n\n          . Hyperleukocytosis or rapidly progressive disease that would compromise ability to\n             complete study therapy\n\n          . QT interval corrected using Fridericia's formula (QTcF) greater than or equal to a\n             Grade , confirmed by  additional seperate electrocardiographs (ECG's) within  days\n             prior to starting study drug. The initial screening ECG need not be repeated for\n             confirmation if the QTcF interval is < milliseconds.\n\n         . Pregnant or breast-feeding females\n\n         . Prior treatment with CAT- (BL), moxetumomab pasudotox, or any\n             pseudomonas-exotoxin-containing compound\n\n         . Prior treatment with any anticancer biologic therapy within  weeks prior to starting\n             study drug, including but not limited to therapeutic monoclonal antibodies or\n             antibody-drug conjugates\n\n         . Systemic chemotherapy ?  weeks ( weeks for nitrosoureas) and radiation therapy ? \n             weeks prior to starting study drug\n\n         . Clinically significant ophthalmologic findings (evidence of retinal damage or injury)\n             during the screening\n\n         . Presence of a second invasive malignancy\n\n         . Uncontrolled pulmonary infection, presence of pulmonary edema\n\n         . Serum albumin <  gram per deciliter (g/dL). Albumin infusions for correction of\n             hypoalbuminemia are allowed, but cannot have administered within  days prior to start\n             of study drug\n\n         . Radioimmunotherapy within  years prior to study start of study drug\n\n         . Participants with prior history of thrombotic microangiopathy or hemolytic uremic\n             syndrome (HUS)\n\n         . T-cell ALL or T-cell lymphoblastic lymphoma\n\n         . Participants currently receiving high-dose estrogen therapy defined as >.\n             milligram per day (mg/day) of an estrogen compound or within  weeks prior to starting\n             study drug.
Inclusion Criteria:\n\n        Donors:\n\n          -  Read, understood and provided written informed consent and willing to comply with all\n             study requirements and procedures\n\n          -   out of  HLA-matched sibling\n\n          -  Negative test for human immunodeficiency virus (HIV), hepatitis B, and hepatitis C\n\n          -  Both male and female patients of childbearing potential enrolled in this trial must\n             use adequate birth control measures\n\n          -  Subjects should be in generally good health and without significant medical\n             conditions, based upon pre-study medical history, physical examination,\n             electrocardiogram (ECG), chest X- ray, and laboratory tests\n\n          -  Meets all criteria to serve as a mobilized blood cell donor in accordance with all\n             applicable individual Transplant Center criteria\n\n        Recipient:\n\n          -  Read, understood and provided written informed consent and willing to comply with all\n             study requirements and procedures\n\n          -   out of  HLA-matched sibling\n\n          -  Both male and female patients of childbearing potential enrolled in this trial must\n             use adequate birth control measures\n\n        Diagnosis of one of following:\n\n          -  Acute Myelogenous Leukemia (AML) in st remission or beyond\n\n          -  Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia (ALL) in st remission or beyond\n\n          -  Chronic Myelogenous Leukemia (CML)\n\n          -  Chronic Lymphoblastic Leukemia (CLL), relapsing after at least one prior regimen\n\n          -  Myelodysplastic Syndrome (MDS), either intermediate ,, or high risk by IPI Scoring\n             System or transfusion dependent\n\n          -  Non-Hodgkins Lymphoma (NHL) or Hodgkins Disease (HD) in nd or greater complete\n             remission, partial remission, or in relapse\n\n          -  Meets all criteria to serve as a transplant recipient in accordance with all\n             applicable individual Transplant Center criteria\n\n        Exclusion Criteria:\n\n        Donors:\n\n          -  Unwilling or unable to give informed consent, or unable to comply with the protocol\n             including required follow-up and testing\n\n          -  Prior treatment with any rhuFltL product\n\n          -  Any vaccination within  weeks prior to CDX- dosing\n\n          -  Donation of blood within  weeks, or donation of plasma within  weeks prior to\n             CDX- dosing\n\n          -  Any experimental treatment within  weeks prior to CDX- dosing\n\n          -  Use of systemic immunosuppressive agents (excluding topical steroids) within  months\n             prior to CDX- dosing.\n\n          -  History of first degree relatives with primary or secondary immunodeficiency to\n             include type  diabetes, multiple sclerosis, rheumatoid arthritis, scleroderma or\n             psoriasis\n\n          -  History of tuberculosis infection\n\n          -  Herpes zoster within  months prior to starting study drug\n\n          -  Pregnant or nursing\n\n        Recipient:\n\n          -  Unwilling or unable to give informed consent, or unable to comply with the protocol\n             including required follow-up and testing\n\n          -  Prior allogeneic transplant\n\n          -  More than one prior autologous transplant\n\n          -  Prior treatment with any rhuFltL product\n\n          -  Any vaccination within  weeks prior to transplant\n\n          -  Uncontrolled infection at the time of the transplant conditioning regimen\n\n          -  Pregnant or nursing\n\n          -  Any condition, which, in the opinion of the clinical investigator, would interfere\n             with the evaluation of the study outcome

Inclusion Criteria:\n\n          . Male or female patients, >  years of age at the time of obtaining informed consent.\n\n          . Patients with a documented solid tumor malignancy that is locally advanced or\n             metastatic; patients with documented multiple myeloma or non-Hodgkin's lymphoma.\n\n          . Patients with a malignancy that is either refractory to standard therapy or for which\n             no standard therapy is available.\n\n          . Patients with a malignancy that is currently not amenable to surgical intervention due\n             to either medical contraindications or non-resectability of the tumor.\n\n          . Dose escalation portion of study: Patients with measurable or non-measurable disease\n             according to standard response criteria .\n\n          . MTD Biopsy Cohort ONLY: Patients with measurable disease with primary or metastatic\n             tumor site(s) considered safely accessible for biopsy; patients must consent to\n             undergo  tumor biopsies.\n\n          . MTD PNET Cohort ONLY: Patients with advanced (unresectable or metastatic),\n             histologically-confirmed low or intermediate grade PNET according to the World Health\n             Organization (WHO)  classification. Patients with neuroendocrine tumors (e.g.,\n             gastrinoma, VIPoma) in whom a pancreatic or peripancreatic primary is strongly\n             suspected are also eligible. Patients must also have:\n\n               -  A Ki- proliferation index < %\n\n               -  Demonstrated radiological evidence of disease progression during or following the\n                  last treatment regimen (based on CT, MRI, or Octreoscan)\n\n               -  Measurable disease according to RECIST v. (determined by CT or MRI). Any\n                  lesions which have been subjected to percutaneous therapies or radiotherapy\n                  should not be considered measureable, unless the lesion has clearly progressed\n                  (per RECIST v.) since the procedure.\n\n               -  Received <  prior systemic treatments for PNET, at least one of which must have\n                  been an FDA-approved targeted therapy for PNET (i.e., sunitinib [Sutent] or\n                  everolimus [Afinitor]). Treatment with a somatostatin analog (SSA) will not be\n                  considered as a systemic treatment for the purposes of eligibility.\n\n          . Patients with an Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group performance status of , , or ,\n             and an anticipated life expectancy of ?  months.\n\n          . Patients, both male and female, who are either not of childbearing potential or who\n             agree to use a medically effective method of contraception during the study and for \n             months after the last dose of study drug.\n\n         . Patients with the ability to understand and give written informed consent for\n             participation in this trial, including all evaluations and procedures as specified by\n             this protocol.\n\n        Exclusion Criteria-Patients:\n\n          . Women who are pregnant or lactating. Women of child-bearing potential (WOCBP), and\n             fertile men with a WOCBP-partner not using and not willing to use a medically\n             effective method of contraception.\n\n          . Patients with known central nervous system (CNS) or leptomeningeal metastases not\n             controlled by prior surgery or radiotherapy, or patients with symptoms suggesting CNS\n             involvement for which treatment is required.\n\n          . Patients with leukemia (any form) or myelodysplastic syndromes.\n\n          . MTD PNET Cohort ONLY: Patients with poorly differentiated, high grade (grade )\n             neuroendocrine carcinoma, as well as patients with adenocarcinoid, goblet cell\n             carcinoid, or small cell carcinoma, or PNET patients with a Ki- proliferation index\n             >  %.\n\n          . Patients with any of the following hematologic abnormalities at baseline:\n\n               -  Absolute neutrophil count < , per mm\n\n               -  Platelet count < , per mm\n\n          . Patients with any of the following serum chemistry abnormalities at baseline:\n\n               -  Total bilirubin > .  the ULN for the institution\n\n               -  AST or ALT >   the ULN for the institution (>   if due to hepatic involvement\n                  by tumor)\n\n               -  Creatinine > .  ULN for the institution\n\n          . Patients with any of the following coagulation parameter abnormalities at baseline:\n\n               -  PT (INR) > .  ULN for the institution\n\n               -  PTT > .  ULN for the institution\n\n          . Patients with:\n\n               -  Active thrombosis, or a history of deep vein thrombosis or pulmonary embolism,\n                  within  months prior to first study drug administration; patients receiving\n                  systemic anti-coagulation for prophylactic or therapeutic reasons\n\n               -  Active uncontrolled bleeding or a known bleeding diathesis\n\n          . Patients with a significant cardiovascular disease or condition, including:\n\n               -  Congestive heart failure currently requiring therapy\n\n               -  Need for antiarrhythmic medical therapy for a ventricular arrhythmia\n\n               -  Severe conduction disturbance (e.g., rd degree heart block)\n\n               -  Angina pectoris requiring therapy\n\n               -  Known left ventricular ejection fraction < % by MUGA or echocardiogram\n\n               -  QTc interval >  msec in males, or >  msec in females\n\n               -  Uncontrolled hypertension (per the Investigator's discretion)\n\n               -  Class III or IV cardiovascular disease according to the New York Heart\n                  Association's Functional Criteria.\n\n               -  Myocardial infarction within  months prior to first study drug administration\n\n         . Patients with a known or suspected hypersensitivity to any of the components of lipid\n             nanoparticle-formulated DCR-MYC.\n\n         . Patients with a known history of human immunodeficiency virus or active infection with\n             hepatitis B virus or hepatitis C virus.\n\n         . Patients with any other serious/active/uncontrolled infection, any infection requiring\n             parenteral antibiotics, or unexplained fever > C within  weeks prior to first\n             study drug administration.\n\n         . Patients with inadequate recovery from an acute toxicity associated with any prior\n             antineoplastic therapy.\n\n         . Patients with inadequate recovery from any prior surgical procedure, or patients\n             having undergone any major surgical procedure within  weeks prior to first study drug\n             administration.\n\n         . Patients with any other life-threatening illness, significant organ system\n             dysfunction, or clinically significant laboratory abnormality, which, in the opinion\n             of the Investigator, would either compromise the patient's safety or interfere with\n             evaluation of the safety of the study drug.\n\n         . Patients with a psychiatric disorder or altered mental status that would preclude\n             understanding of the informed consent process and/or completion of the necessary\n             study-related evaluations.\n\n         . Patients with the inability or with foreseeable incapacity, in the opinion of the\n             Investigator, to comply with the protocol requirements.\n\n        Exclusion Criteria-Treatments:\n\n          . MTD PNET Cohort ONLY: Greater than  prior systemic treatments for the underlying\n             malignancy\n\n          . Any antineoplastic agent for the primary malignancy (standard or experimental) within\n              weeks prior to first study drug administration with the exception of monoclonal\n             antibody therapy, nitrosoureas, and nitrogen mustard for the primary malignancy within\n              weeks prior to first study drug administration\n\n          . Radiotherapy for the primary malignancy within  weeks prior to first study drug\n             administration and during study.\n\n          . Herbal preparations or related over-the-counter preparations/supplements containing\n             herbal ingredients within  weeks prior to first study drug administration and during\n             study.\n\n          . This includes participation in any\n             medical device or therapeutic intervention clinical trials.\n\n          . -  Subjects with Philadelphia negative B-precursor ALL, with any of the following:\n\n               -  refractory to primary induction therapy or refractory to salvage therapy,\n\n               -  in untreated first relapse with first remission duration < months\n\n               -  in untreated second or greater relapse\n\n               -  relapse at any time after allogeneic HSCT\n\n          -  Subject has received intensive combination chemotherapy for the treatment of ALL for\n             initial treatment or subsequent salvage therapy.\n\n          -  Greater than % blasts in the bone marrow\n\n          -  Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status ?
